215 booster pumps seized.description: Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation officials have seized 215 booster (tullu) pumps which were being used illegally to draw excess water from pipelines. The drive was launched in May. The highest number of cases were reported in Ashi Nagar zone where 55 residents were found using booster pumps. In Satranjipura zone, the joint team of NMC and Orange City Water (OCW) detected booster pumps at 45 houses. In south-west assembly constituency, a special squad caught 36 residents using tullu pumps. According to data shared by OCW, two cases of illegal usage of tullu pumps came to fore in Dharampeth zone, 22 in Dhantoli, 10 in Nehru Nagar, eight in Gandhibagh and 21 in Lakadganj. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Data on crime against Dalits too good to.description: NAGPUR: Chairman of National Scheduled Castes (SC) Commission Shanker Katheria said the figures reported to him by local police, that only 43 crimes have taken place against Dalits in the city, with no case of murder or rape registered during last one year, are too good to believed. Katheria, who is on a tour gathering data throughout the state before a review meeting in August, said it seems there is a need to relook into the figures. Out of the 43, four cases have been registered under Atrocities Act, he said. Charge sheets have been filed in all except four cases, he said. However, he also admitted that if true indeed, then the condition of SCs is much better in Maharashtra. as compared to states like Haryana, Rajasthan or Uttar Pradesh where it is a matter of concern indeed. “If it’s 43 cases in Nagpur, then in a similar area in a state like Haryana, Uttar Pradesh or Rajasthan it would be easily up to 200,” said Katheria while talking to newspersons here. Katheria expressed concern over the overall condition of SCs in the country. He said, “Even as not much cannot be commented without exact data in hand, the overall condition is not very satisfying. There are many pockets in which the quotas for jobs or education have not been filled up entirely.” “Last week, a Dalit family was a victim of a political mob violence in West Bengal. Six members of a family including a 16-year old girl are missing and three people have been killed. We have raised concern against political violence against the community,” he said. Katheria was told by scribes at the meeting about the murder of 54-year-old Usha Kamble and her one-and-a-half-year-old granddaughter, that took place last year at Pawamsut Nagar, near Dighori Naka. “This means that it was not true that no murder of a Dalit took place during last one year,” said the scribes. He assured to look into the matter. “The local authorities were not in a position to furnish information about the status related to education and benefits of reservation availed by the community in Nagpur. At the same time, I was told that the government schools were in a poor condition with many not even having toilets for girl students,” he said. The commission will also clear 100 serious cases from Maharashtra, which are related to Atrocities Act or alleged injustices in services in month’s time. There are 40,000 cases from the entire country pending with the commission, he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur dist to plant 98.39L saplings.description: Nagpur: As many 98.39 lakh saplings will be planted in the Nagpur district, said district guardian minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Saturday.After chairing a review meeting on the state government’s plantation drive on July 1, Bawankule said the drive will be made successful with a slogan ‘One House, Two Trees.’ Under the state government’s 33 crore sapling plantation drive, 54 state and central government organizations will participate in the drive. “Last year, the district witnessed plantations of 15,85,822 saplings, of which 13,15,463 survived,” claimed Bawankule. This year, 7,606 spots have been identified for sapling plantations across the district and over 68.26 lakh holes were made for the plantations, he said. He also asked the officials to ensure tree guards are placed for saplings planted in public places.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nStudents of ETC department of Yeshwant.description: It was time for the final year students of ETC department, Yeshwantrao Chavan College of Engineering, to bid goodbye to their college life. The farewell bash, which was organised recently on the college premises, was full of fun and nostalgia. Partying with their friends one last time, youngsters experienced a gamut of emotions. While outstation students were sad to leave the city, many seemed excited to join the companies they have been placed in through campus recruitment. Girls and boys didn’t forget to click numerous selfies and group snaps, which were instantly updated on their social media accounts. To add some more fun to the bash, various games were organised wherein seniors and juniors enthusiastically participated. Later, a leg-pulling session not only evoked plenty of laughter, but also proved to be a catalyst in making the bond stronger between the juniors and seniors. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Rs15L pay package for fire engg graduate.description: Nagpur: A graduate of the first batch of the revamped BE (Fire Engineering) course from National Fire Service College (NFSC) has bagged a pay package of Rs15 lakh per annum. This is almost at par with what a graduate from the premier Indian Institute of Management (IIM)-Nagpur gets. With 100% placement, the average salary package for all 43 NFSC students was around Rs10 lakh, said college officials. The BE (Fire) course was restarted at the college in 2015 after decade’s gap with the new four-year pattern that adhered to AICTE guidelines and had JEE marks as the admission criteria with Std XII as minimum education. The earlier course, started in 1978, was of 3.5 years and had BSc as the minimum eligibility criteria. GS Saini, director of NFSC, said, “Major oil companies are the employers and it’s a great start for these fresh graduates. It’s a matter of pride that all students from our first batch have got excellent job offers.” He added that their campus boasts of state-of-the-art labs, training equipment, faculty and hands-on experience. “In the world there are just two colleges where you can do this BE (Fire) course, which is recognized by all authorities. One is in London and the other is in Nagpur,” said Saini. The director said that admissions for the 2019-20 academic session closes on June 20.Senior city academician Sanjay Charalwar says that it is good to see such graduates getting good job offers. “When these children joined about four years ago, even they would not have known that such high pay package will be offered to them. In the more common courses like MBA etc, the principle of demand-supply kicks in. And that’s the case with these ‘mob psychology courses’ because so many students pass out from colleges that there is not enough capacity in the market to absorb all of them,” said Charalwar. Hotels in Nagpur recently conducted fire safety awareness among its members. The hoteliers say there is a big demand for trained professionals in this sector. Tejinder Singh Renu, president of Nagpur Residential Hotels Association (NRHA), said, “Across cities there is growing awareness about fire safety and in turn demand for trained professionals. As of now there is a huge gap between the two, so companies will have to pay a premium for human resources.” Renu added that this sector will always be “human intensive”. “Machines can raise an alarm but can’t decide how to fight which kind of fire. Human intervention is absolutely necessary and that’s why a healthy demand will continue,” he said. NFSC, which was set up in UP in 1950 was shifted to Nagpur in the 1970s, is not resting on its laurels and is already looking forward to taking things to the next level. Saini said, “We are working on a proposal to start India’s first MTech course in fire engineering. That will be good for students who wish to continue after bachelor's degree or come back later to upgrade their knowledge and add on to their qualification.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tadoba to close core, buffer to remain o.description: CHANDRAPUR: The core zone of Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve will close down for monsoon from July 1. Park management is, however, going to continue with full-fledged tourism in buffer zone of the tiger reserve during the monsoon. Tadoba has become an internationally acclaimed tiger destination and people from across the world come here to see tigers in the wild. Tadoba once again registered rise in tourist numbers during last year. The number of tourist visitors during year 2018-19 has crossed the 1.75 lakh mark. Even sizzling temperature of 47 degree in Chandrapur failed to deter tourists during the summer. More than 60,000 tourists have visited Tadoba since May 1, sources said. However, TATR management has decided for full closure of the core zone of the park during the monsoon months, complying with directives of NTCA. However, tourists will be able to enjoy tiger safari in buffer, which have equally good tiger population. Park management is going to offer entry into the buffer circuits from seven gates during the monsoon months. Tourists will have choice of online as well as spot booking for safari in buffer zone. Deputy director, TATR (buffer) sent a letter to project coordinator of Maha Online Company Ltd requesting to open online booking for seven gates in four ranges in buffer zone. Mahaecotourism portal is likely to open bookings for seven buffer gates at Agarzari, Devada-Adegaon, Alijhanjha, Ramdegi-Navegaon, Kolara, Kolara-Madnapur and Mamla zones in four buffer ranges. Nagpur: MD drug kingpin nabbed.description: NAGPUR: With the arrest of two drug peddlers, the anti-narcotics cell of the city crime branch have busted a major drug racket. The accused have been identified as Mujahid Ahmed Ashraf, the alleged kingpin, and Imran Dalla. Police nabbed the duo and seized 55 grams of Mephedrone commonly known as ‘MD’ in the wee hours of Friday at Gittikhadan. Besides the drugs, police have also a car, in all worth Rs9.65 lakh. The cops had received a tip-off about two men, having a huge consignment of MD drug, waiting in a car at Gittikhadan for delivery. Police raided the spot and nabbed the accused. It is learnt that since the mastermind of the racket Feroze Khan alias Abu was nabbed and sent to jail, Mujahid had taken over the business. However, he was selling the drug to consumers by ditching the middle men due to which the cops were having a hard time nabbing him. The anti-narcotics cell, under the guidance of PI RD Nikam, nabbed them. It is learnt that Mujahid had been selling the drug to several high-profile clients. The duo has been booked under sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

No briquette at Ambazari ghat,NMC chargi.description: Nagpur: In June 2015, the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) had made firewood chargeable at Ambazari ghat to promote eco-friendly cremation using briquette. However, for the last 45 days, there is no stock of briquette at the country’s first eco-friendly crematorium and people are forced to pay Rs2,329 per cremation for firewood. As cremation falls under essential and sensitive services, the NMC should ensure sufficient quantity of briquette round-the-clock. In case of no stock of briquette, the civic body is supposed to provide firewood free of cost. Firewood is provided free of cost at other crematoria in the city. As per information available from activists and corporators, employees of NMC Laxmi Nagar Zone and activists had three months ago informed the NMC health department about no supply of briquette from the contractor. The crematorium then had stock for only one-and-a-half months but the department did nothing. Chairman of NMC projects consultative committee Sanjay Bangale told TOI this is sheer negligence on part of NMC officials. “Whatever may be the technical problems, there should be no excuses for non-supply of briquette. Many families cannot afford Rs2,329 for cremation,” he said. He said directives have been given to health department officials to ensure sufficient stock of briquette at the crematorium within four days. Health officer Dr Sunil Kamble told TOI that quotation will be invited soon to get briquette. “We had appointed a private contractor through tendering process around seven months ago. The supply stopped after contractor started facing some financial issues. As per norms, we cannot go for another tender unless the contract is terminated. It took three months to complete the process. The contractor will be terminated and blacklisted next week,” he said. Ambazari Ghat also has facility for cremation using LPG gas. On June 5, 2015, the then mayor Pravin Datke in association with city-based NGO Eco Friendly Living Foundation led by Vijay Limaye and Vivek Phadke had declared Ambazari ghat as eco-friendly. Plan was to promote cremation using briquette instead of firewood. Briquette is made up of waste from agriculture farms. Plan was to develop other eco-friendly crematoriums in a phased manner but NMC did nothing in this regard in last four years. Limaye said following use of briquette, city had become a role model for eco-friendly crematorium and cremation. “Towns like Yavatmal and couple of more have also adopted the technology. Demo has also been given at many other cities. Apart from environment conservation, briquette is best model of waste to wealth and additional revenue source for farmers,” he said. Kamble said plan is to make four more crematoria eco-friendly in this year. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Assault on revenue officials: Cops final.description: NAGPUR: After passage of several weeks Nandanvan police has finally added Section 307 of Indian Penal Code (IPC) (attempt to murder) in the first information report (FIR) registered against sand smugglers for trying to run over a team of revenue officials. The cops had registered an offence against the accused under lighter sections until they received a directive from district collector Ashwin Mudgal. Naib tehsildar Sunil Salve and six others had gone to Kharbi-Wathoda Ring Road on April 23 morning to check illegal transport of sand. Two trucks bearing registration numbers MH-40-AK 8056 and MH-36-F 4157 were stopped and the sand being transported by them was inspected. According to preliminary estimates they were carrying about six brass of sand. At around 8.30am, a Mercedes Benz car (MH-41-AA-8100) coming from the wrong side tried to run over Salve and circle officer HP Maliye. The two truck drivers refused to produce any documents regarding sand transport and verbally abused the team members. The drivers threatened the officials with dire consequences. The Mercedes driver also asked the two truck drivers to flee from the spot. When the revenue officials tried to pursue them, they fled in three different directions. The revenue officials then went to Nandanvan police station and met PI Vinayak Chavhan. The cops only registered offences under Sections 353 and 34 of IPC (creating obstacle in government work). Salve and others complained to Mudgal alleging that cops were going soft on the smugglers. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Two murders, one murderous assault rock.description: NAGPUR: Two murders, and a murderous assault on a gangster, within 24 hours left the city cops in a tizzy on Sunday. Ganesh Tandulkar, an autorickshaw stand coordinator at Jhansi Rani Chowk, was allegedly hacked to death by a gang of fellow drivers on Saturday. The assailants were apparently enraged that he shielded a man they wanted to eliminate. The incident took place at Udibaba Chowk in MIDC. The MIDC police acted quickly in the Tandulkar murder case, arresting three assailants, Abhijeet Singh, Rakesh Kuryavanshi and Vicky Dabekar. Within hours, 22-year-old Gaurav Nagpure was stabbed to death by his rivals near a community toilet at Gangabai Ghat within the jurisdiction of Kotwali police station. Nagpure was attacked by his neighbours-turned-foe Tejas Bagde, Shoaeb Malik, Bobby Malik and others with sharp weapons over old rivalry. The injured Nagpure was rushed to hospital, where he was declared dead. Later in the evening, city and rural police set off on another chase when news of a murderous assault on gangster Viju Mohod started doing the rounds. Sources in the police said Mohod, who had kidnapped gangster Maroti Nuwa around two months ago, was apparently kidnapped from an eatery by close aides of another gangster, and thrashed up very badly. Staffers from Beltarodi, Nandanvan, and Sakkardara police stations of city, and Kuhi in rural, started a frenetic search to track down more information. Mohod had a dispute with another goon, identified as Amit Bilge, some days back, which was settled at marriage of one Bobby. Despite this, Mohod had been attacked by his rivals, and was in critical condition at hospital when reports last came in. The mastermind of the gang that attacked Mohod had been arrested by Pachpaoli police in an offence registered in 2017. In the same offence, the gangster had been freed even after being nabbed by crime branch, due to alleged political influence and support of a builder. In the Tandulkar murder, police said the assailants wanted to eliminate one Dinesh Pandey, also an autorickshaw driver, to teach him a lesson for confronting them earlier in the day. The three assailants are trying to establish their dominance at the autorickshaw stand, and Pandey had abused Singh in a lighter vein earlier in the day. It’s learnt that Tandulkar, whose cousin is posted at crime branch, too had a wordy duel with Vicky earlier in the day. Later, Pandey and Singh, who were once classmates, exchanged abuse at the autorickshaw stand at Rani Jhansi Chowk. They were separated by Tandulkar before he left to attend a family programme at Timki. In Tandulkar’s absence, Dabekar assaulted Pandey with a sword on his right shoulder. Pandey went to a hospital at Hingna and informed Tandulkar and another autorickshaw driver Chandrakant Bhagwat. Tandulkar and Bhagwat rushed to the hospital, picked up Pandey and dropped him home safely. Some time later, Tandulkar got a call on his cell phone from Kuryavanshi, who summoned him to Udibaba Chowk. Kuryavanshi and Dabekar wanted Tandulkar to call Pandey too at the spot. Tandulkar reached the spot but kept pleading with the assailants to forgive Pandey and forget the incident. As Kuryavanshi and Dabekar started getting aggressive, Tandulkar tried to sneak away in Bhagwat’s autorickshaw. But Kuryavanshi and Dabekar attacked Tandulkar, and while Singh thrashed Tandulkar, Dabekar assaulted him with a sword. MIDC police have registered an offence of murder against four persons, including the three already in custody. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Private doctors pan India to strike work.description: NAGPUR: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) national body has called for closure of all non-essential services including the OPDs for 24 hours from 6am on Monday to 6am on Tuesday pan India in the private sector. Except for emergency and casualty services all diagnostic facilities in pathology, radiology etc will remain closed. The call comes following the ongoing agitation against the brutal attack on Dr Paribaha Mukherjee, by a violent mob at NRS Medical College, Kolkata. IMA is also observing nationwide protest on Saturday and Sunday by wearing black badges, taking out peaceful protest marches, dharnas and demonstrations. Dr Kush Jhunjhunwala, Nagpur IMA president said that IMA demands the biggest possible action by the West Bengal government. All the legitimate demands of the resident doctors in West Bengal should be accepted unconditionally. Dr Ashutosh Jadhav, general secretary of central MARD in state told TOI that on Monday all residents across India will wear helmets and black badges while working under the banner of the United Resident Doctors’ Association. IMA has requested all other associations of the fraternity to join in the struggle. IMA has been demanding a national law against hospital violence. IMA has declared a zero-tolerance policy against violence on doctors and health care establishments. Dr Ashok Adhao, Patron IMA Nagpur and IMA Maharashtra, Dr Kush Jhunjhunwala President and Dr Manjusha Giri Hon. Secretary IMA Nagpur have appealed all allopathic doctors to keep their non essential services closed for 24 hours from Monday 6am. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Doctors strike.description: Healthcare in hospitals across the country is set for a major disruption on Monday with   Indian Medical Association   deciding to withdraw non-essential services for a day to express solidarity with their striking colleagues in Bengal. However, in a move that may bring some relief to patients in New Delhi, AIIMS resident doctors have decided not to join the strike. But those in Safdarjung Hospital, Lady Hardinge Medical College, RML Hospital and others will skip work. In Kolkata on Sunday, the agitating doctors said they were ready to meet Mamata Banerjee "anytime and anywhere". The government proposed a 3pm meeting at the state secretariat on Monday. The doctors were reportedly ready to accept the proposal. IMA strike to cripple OPDs todayEarlier, the junior doctors had insisted that the meeting cannot be held behind closed doors and the media should be allowed to telecast it live. The state government, however, cited legalities and constitutional propriety, which prevent such meetings from being held under public glare. The doctors were ready to accept the government's request, sources indicated late Sunday, which would pave the way for "across-the-table" discussions between the protesters and the chief minister. "We are very hopeful for the meeting in Nabanna (state secretariat) on Monday," a senior official, mediating for the state, said. "We have explained to them that given the issues involved, mainly legal, administrative and security-related, it is impossible for the state government to agree to their demand for an open-door meeting in presence of the media. The CM is also sworn to an oath of secrecy in some such matters. We have explained they have every right to speak to media afterwards, much like the norm in all such cases. They have agreed to it," he said. Under pressure from several quarters, including the seniors in the medical fraternity, the junior doctors in Kolkata held a four-hour general body meeting at NRS Hospital. The meeting appeared to split three ways. While a section of doctors agreed to have the meeting at Nabanna, another section stressed on Raj Bhavan as the venue, while the remaining stuck to their demand for NRS Hospital. Pressure further mounted on the striking doctors to find a solution to the standoff. At 3.30pm, a group of doctors announced their stand. "We are hopeful that our CM will be considerate enough to solve the problems that the state is facing in the healthcare sector currently," they said in a statement while refusing to accept any question from the media. "We leave the decision to choose the venue to the honourable CM, but it should accommodate representatives of all medical colleges of West Bengal in sufficient numbers," the statement read. They expressed willingness to join work, "as early as possible in the best interest of the common people once our demands are addressed". NNTR drivers may get aid for new vehicle.description: NAGPUR: Looking at the pathetic condition of safari vehicles at Navegaon-Nagzira Tiger Reserve (NNTR), officials are aggressively working on a plan to help local drivers get financial assistance for purchase of new four wheelers. On Tuesday itself a gypsy broke down during the evening safari, forcing a tourist to walk 4km inside the core jungle. Forest officials are exploring options of negotiating a good deal with banks or getting funds through some government scheme. Poonam Pate, NNTR deputy director (core) said, “We are trying to see if a discounted rate of interest can be negotiated for vehicle loans. They did a similar thing in Tadoba and we are trying to work along the same route.” Another option for the forest officials is to dip into funds from some state or central government scheme. “That option is at a very preliminary stage and a bit of a remote possibility for now. But we are trying to find out if there is some kind of scheme where we can access funds for new vehicles,” said Pate. There are 43 vehicles plying in NNTR with a majority of them in bad shape. Many consider it a miracle that these vehicles don’t break down as often as they should. While pulling the plug on all these vehicles may seem the logical thing to do, forest officials say the solution isn’t practical. “This would mean taking away employment opportunities from villagers who reside here. They are not in a position to invest their own money to buy new vehicles. In fact, some of them may not even be in a position to get it financed either. These are ground realities that one needs to keep in mind before taking any decision and that is why we are exploring options to help them,” said Pate. Maintenance of vehicles to prolong their life is also out of the question at this point of time. Sources say these vehicles are literally running on ‘prayers’ and there is no scope for any kind of mechanical intervention to salvage the vehicles. Kohle raps PWD for shoddy work of IRR pr.description: NAGPUR: Sudhakar Kohle, city BJP president and South Nagpur MLA, has slammed officials of state’s public works department (PWD) for improper planning and inferior quality of works under Inner Ring Road (IRR) cement concrete project. He also intends to take up the issue with chief minister Devendra Fadnavis and also raise it in the state Assembly for stringent action against the officials. Following complaints from citizens, Kohle along with the officials of PWD, Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) and SNDL inspected the stretch of newly-constructed cement concrete road between Manewada Square and Mhalgi Nagar a couple of days ago. Kohle said two nullahs on IRR’s stretch between Manewada Square and Mhalgi Nagar have been totally blocked, posing threat during monsoon. “The nullahs at Ambika Nagar and Mhalgi Nagar square have been covered with concrete. Now, how will water pass from one side of the road to other? There should be proper planning and execution to ensure that the nullahs flow freely,” he said. Kohle also slammed the officials for not repairing the pothole at Mhalgi Nagar Square despite repeated reminders. “Heaps of materials and sand are lying unattended on the road since long. This can cause accidents and severe inconvenience to the public,” he said. He gave the officials an ultimatum of four days to resolve all the issues. PWD chief engineer Ulhas Debadwar, NMC assistant commissioner Raju Bhivgade, superintending engineers Vidyadhar Sardeshmukh (PWD) and Manoj Talewar (NMC), corporators Abhay Gotekar, Swati Akhatkar, Rita Mule and Snehal Bihare were present during the inspection. The Rs205 crore IRR project, which was supposed to be completed by September 2017, is marred with inferior quality of work and inordinate delays. TOI has many a time exposed flaws in the project. Activist Suraj Lolge had filed a criminal writ petition in the High Court alleging poor quality, nexus between officials and contractor RPS Infraprojects Private Ltd, revenue loss and various types of violations. \u2018Ravi Paar\u2019 portrays struggle.description: Nagpur: Struggle, pain and sufferings of migrants, who had to leave their native places after the partition of India, moved the audience as the play ‘Ravi Paar’, based on the story written by celebrated author and lyricist Gulzar, was staged at Chitnavis Centre, on Sunday. “Manjoor nahi manjoor nahi, humein ye faisala manjoor nahi”, a group of angry Punjabis chants in chorus to express their disapproval and agony over the decision of Lord Mountbatten and top officials to divide India into two parts with the creation of Pakistan. The play dates back to 1947 when people began to see the sun of freedom approaching, but the cost and consequences of it were still unknown. The decision of the British Raj to divide India shattered the lives of many, causing the biggest migration ever happened in history. The drama revolves around Baandish, the central character of the play, who is a Sikh living in undivided India (which is now in Pakistan) and his struggle while migrating from his land, leaving behind his memories, childhood, dreams, and his mother. The actors effectively portrayed the pain and sufferings of the people with throbbing performances and top notch acting. The play offered a glimpse into undivided India by showcasing brotherhood among Hindu-Muslims, love for each other’s traditions, lifestyle and religious beliefs. The decision to divide the country pitted these two communities against each other. The Punjabi attire of characters, old household set-up, precision of dialogues and quality of expression made the play a treat to the eyes of spectators. The concluding part of the play which showcased the dark side of partition, resulting into mass deaths, poverty, unhygienic conditions and emotional baggage of leaving behind their homes, touched the audience. A scene in the play shows a young boy, playing with his grandfather, asks him, “Who lives on that side of the border Dadu? As he gets a reply that there’s is a new Hindustan in the making, he nods his head in disapproval and says, “I don’t want to leave our home.” The play ended on an emotional note. The curator and director of the play Mithun Hatwar of Zero Miles Studio said, “This play is close to my heart. We are connected to each other through art, and acting is one of the beautiful mediums to express yourself. I have concern for the pain and sufferings people faced during Partition. At the same time, I am happy that my team was able to bring out the essence of it for viewers.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gripping stories mark Saptak drama festi.description: Nagpur: Two plays — ‘The Conscious’ and ‘Rang Bhulaiyya’ — staged by Saptak as part of Govind Hari Velankar one-act festival at Scientific Society Hall, gave the audience a gripping experience with good storyline and acting. ‘The Conscious’ is based on a painting of King Argus Belleno of Scotland. The king had a weird habit of punishing criminals. If someone is caught in the crime, he would ask the accused to recreate the scene in a period of seven days. If the accused repeats it, then he/she would be handed out punishment depending on the nature of crime that was perpetrated. Legend has it that after the king’s death, his painting started giving punishment. Interestingly, this would happen to those who buys it. The drama starts with highly egoistic Shyam, proud of his intelligence, dominates his wife Meera as she is not able to match him. As Shyam owns the painting, the rule applies to him, of facing punishment for a crime. With Shyam going hammer and tongs, a person named Manasvi comes in the picture who tells him about the legend and that today is the seventh day since he bought the painting. However, Shyam refuses to believe Manasvi and asks him to leave. He keeps arguing with his wife over trivial issues. This, according to legend, is also a crime in the eyes of the painting. Manasvi tells him that this is the last chance to mend ways it being the seventh day. But Shyam gives two hoots to his advise that the painting would punish him for the crime and beats up Meera. Not able to differentiate between the legend and the present in which he is living, Shyam becomes a lunatic and runs away from the house. The moral of the story, according to Manasvi, is that ‘What we sow is what we reap.” Actors Nachiket Mhaisalkar (Shyam), Himani Ballal (Meera) and Gaurav Khone (Manasvi) gave stellar performances. The drama was directed well by Nachiket. The second drama, ‘Rang Bhulaiyya’, is about three college friends Abhi, Ashwini and Sameer. Sameer’s mother is suffering from cancer when Ashwini is about to be promoted as a senior software in-charge for a new project. When Sameer comes to know about it, he approaches Ashwini and tells her that he can’t afford his mother’s treatment. Sameer says he would get promotion if she turns it down so that he could get extra money and be able to give his mother good medical treatment. Ashwini discusses the issue with Abhi and her boss Sourav who ask her to think practically and find a middle path. Ashwini then tells Sameer to choose between being greedy and stealing someone else’s promotion or share the expenses for his mother’s treatment. The drama, written by Arvind Limkhe, was well received. Abhiteej Mudhe, Lalit Dhavdhave, Chaitanya Dubey and Shreya Joshi acted well. The audience stayed till the last and gave the cast a standing ovation for superb performances. (Reporting by Himesh Pande) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman cop\u2019s parting gift: Rs51,000.description: Nagpur: Police naik constable Hemlata Khadgi (Gokhe), 48, who opted for voluntary retirement with 11 years still to go, gave her colleagues at Jaripatka police station a rest room as a parting gift. She contributed Rs51,000 from the benefits she got from the department to ensure a room was erected for women colleagues. A rest room for women cops at the police station struck Hemlata as one of the biggest requirements, to ensure they have a place for a breather in between strenuous working schedule at odd hours. Hemlata had worked the night shift continuously for five years, to ensure her only son Dhruv’s upbringing was not affected, as her husband Deepak worked at a central government office in regular office hours. In fact, it was Deepak’s transfer to Gujarat that prompted Hemlata to quit and follow him there. “I worked in the night and looked after my son in the day time when my husband was at office. One of us had to sacrifice for our son’s sake. We could compromise on everything but not on the son’s upbringing,” she said. “At times, I used to look around the police station in the wee hours of the day, trying to find a corner to just lay down for a while out of exhaustion,” she said, “Sometimes even a woman complainant would land up at odd hours with children in tow, and have nowhere to go.” “I hope my contribution will help my women colleagues rest and also change in case they get drenched in rain or something,” she said. Hemlata’s send-off also had a different hue as it was held, upon her insistence, at the Government Observation Home for children at Patankar Chowk on June 14, and not at the police station as usual. Hemlata’s gifted clothes to the underprivileged inmates, and complete sets of books and stationary to two students of standards X and IX. Hemlata’s decision lit up the lives of the inmates of the government home for one day, as Jaripatka police too turned it into an ‘Eid milan’, distributing ‘Sheer kurma’ to all. Hemlata, who joined the police department 21 years and six months ago, has always celebrated special moments at places like old age homes and orphanages, whether birthdays or anniversaries. “It brings special happiness if shared with people who need love and care more than others,” said Hemlata. Helping children too is nothing new too for Hemlata, something she had been doing as a cop too. “I had taken several abandoned and unattended children to safe shelters. Once I rushed a newly-born baby to orphanage after spotting him at a dumping site at Mominpura. The baby survived, and I still have his picture in my mobile phone, and keep seeing it from time to time,” said the woman cop, who now intends to be a housewife at least for the foreseeable future. Man-eater leopard captured.description: Chandrapur: The man-eater leopard responsible for killing a toddler and a woman in Gadbori was finally tranquillized and captured on Saturday evening. It had lifted both toddler and the old woman from their house and took them to forest before killing them. The leopard had terrorized Ratnapur village, Navargaon, Waneri and Gadbori in Sidewahi tehsil since the last few weeks. It had not only killed two people from Gadbori, but had also made many cattle kills in the area. People in these villages were afraid to go to their fields fearing attacks. The villagers had even stopped sleeping out of house as the beast had started intruding and taking away people. The villagers had started night vigil in their villages fearing leopard attack. The capturing of the beast was ordered immediately, but wrong leopardess was captured in one of the four cages deployed in Gadbori. The problem leopard had made second kill in the same village on the same night when its mate was captured. Fearing more attacks, the forest department had also deployed rapid response unit to tranquillizing and capture the problem leopard. The hunting team tracked the leopard in revenue gate no. 18, near Nachanbhatti village. A sharp shooter darted the animal at 7pm and the beast fell unconscious after ten minutes. Soon after foresters were sure that the leopard is sedated, they captured and caged it. The officials said that after physical examination of the animal by a veterinary doctor, it will be shifted to Gorewada zoo and rescue centre.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

IO booked for inviting woman complainant.description: Nagpur: A sensational murder case now has taken a bizarre turn as the 25-year-old woman complainant in the case has indicted the investigation officer (IO) for allegedly having outraged her modesty by asking her out for a movie. He also apparently shared the image of the movie ticket with her.The IO, sub-inspector SS Temgire, has been booked by the Ajni police station where he is currently posted. Section 354 (D) of the IPC has been invoked against Temgire. If proven guilty, Temgire can be imprisoned up to three years and fined too.The women told the cops that Temgire deleted the image of the move ticket after taking the cell phone from her on some pretext. Police are likely to send the cell phone to cyber forensic experts.Sources from the police station said Temgire had registered a murder offence after a man was murdered with swords at a marriage venue in New Babulkheda. A close friend of the victim too was injured. The complainant woman is the friend’s sister.The family members of the deceased were unhappy with the probe as they felt cops were shielding the person who called the murder victim out of the marriage venue. The woman said Ajni police did not book this person as he was a relative of another cop posted in Hudkeshwar. Sources in Ajni police station said Temgire asked the woman to come to the police station at 9.30pm to meet him along with the brother’s blood-stained clothes either by herself or with the brother.Temgire apparently messaged the woman that he was considerate in allowing her to take the brother’s two-wheeler, else “it would have happened through a court procedure only”.Ajni police said that Temgire would put the woman in discomfort with late calls or messages. The complaint was accepted after she met zonal DCP Raj Tilak Raushan.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Liquor addict scales prison security wal.description: NAGPUR: A 37-year-old man, identified as Prakash Kotangale, was arrested after he took the security system of Central Jail by surprise by scaling its periphery wall on Friday. He was later handed over to Dhantoli police. Police said Kotangale, addicted to liquor, was spotted on an unoccupied sentry watch tower of the periphery wall of the jail. He was wearing a scarf around the waist. Jail security personnel nabbed Kotangale from the tower in the presence of SP Rani Bhosale and grilled him. Sources said Kotangale had accessed the tower through the stairs used by the armed sentries on duty. Police said Kotangale, a resident of Swaroop Nagar, does not have any crime records and may have scaled the tower under the influence of liquor. During interrogation, Kotangale stated he had to take shelter at the sentry tower after being chased by an unidentified four-wheeler and another man with a weapon in his hand. Senior PI of Dhantoli police station Prasad Sanas said the family of Kotangale was also summoned. “Kotangale seemed to have got mentally disturbed after consuming liquor following which he tried to scale the wall,” he said. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. \u2018Main Gadha Hoon\u2019 has the audi.description: Nagpur: ‘Main Gadha Hoon’, a stand-up comedy staged by Shreyas Manohar at Vishnuji Ki Rasoi on Saturday, was a mix of satire and mimicry and touched on many issues of people, including use of phone by teens and adults alike. Vishnu Manohar, Vijay Jathe and Milind Deshkar were the organizers of the show. The event commenced with Vishnu Manohar and Jathe entertaining the people by explaining the idea of a stand-up comedy and sharing their anecdotes here and there that made the atmosphere lighter. Shreyas Manohar, known for his humour and charm, was the main attraction as he talked about his time in New York, Goa and Mumbai. He gave many instances of his stay at different places. He spoke on topics like success and the blessings needed for it. He asked the people questions like if they thought their dreams had become a reality. “Do you really think you are successful? I mean it’s definitely arguable,” he asked jokingly. Shreyas took potshots at what he termed WhatsApp University Community being formed most of whose members are adults and kitty party members. “You adults blame us youngsters for being on the phone all the time. Well, it’s not true any more. Look how the tables have turned,” he said amid laughter. He got in conversation with someone in the crowd, one of them was Jathe. “I appreciate you cutting me off for the fourth time, sir. It’s not disturbing at all,” he said when Jathe asked him to speak louder. This was followed by a roar of laughter from the audience. Manohar talked about his life in Mumbai and how people there were really hardworking. “If you try to wake up at 7am, the neighbour is already up at 6am. If you wake up at 6am, the neighbour woke up at 4.30am to go for a jog. If you wake up the next day at 4.30am, you come to find out that the neighbour did not sleep at all the previous night. That is some high level hard work you have to do for that.” He also talked about his experience abroad and how and what Americans thought of India. “Once a girl asked me what was my favourite flavour of ice-cream to which I replied vanilla. She was so shocked when I told her that vanilla was sold in India.” (Reporting by Shristi Sankrit) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Parliament Session.description: NEW DELHI: The first session of the 17th Lok Sabha will commence from Monday during which the passage of the Union Budget and other key legislations such as triple talaq will be on top of the agenda for the government. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, chairing an all-party meeting on the eve of the first session of the new Lok Sabha, invited heads of all parties to a meeting on June 19 to discuss the "one nation, one election" issue and other important matters. Noting that there are many new faces in this Lok Sabha, PM Modi said the first session of the lower house of Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". At the all-party meeting, the Congress raised with the government issues of unemployment, farmers distress, drought, and press freedom, while also calling for early conduct of assembly polls in Jammu and Kashmir. The opposition parties demanded discussion on all such issues in Parliament, with the Congress asserting that it is still a "fight of ideologies". Prime Minister Modi, defence minister Rajnath Singh, leader of opposition in the Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad, Congress lawmakers Adhir Ranjan Choudhary, K Suresh, National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah and TMC leader Derek O'Brien were present at the meeting. The BJP also held its parliamentary party meet on Sunday with Prime Minister Modi assuring Indians that his government will be at the forefront of facilitating legislation that manifests the spirit of "sabka saath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas". A day before the first session of the newly-constituted 17th Lok Sabha, a meeting of the NDA was also held here. The government had promulgated as many as 10 ordinances for the session which ends on July 26 and will have 30 sittings. The first two days of the session will be used for administering oath of office to all Lok Sabha MPs. The oath will be administered by protem Speaker Virender Kumar. The Speaker will be elected on June 19 and the next day the President will address a joint sitting of both Houses. The budget will be introduced on July 5. Among the bills that will be introduced, the one on triple talaq could be a contentious one between the government and the opposition. Addressing the media after the all-party meeting, parliamentary affairs minister Prahlad Joshi said the Prime Minister urged leaders of all parties to "introspect whether members of Parliament are able to fulfil people's aspirations as their representatives and the manner in which last two years of the 16th Lok Sabha were wasted". An all-party meeting is a customary procedure before the beginning of every session of Parliament to ensure its smooth functioning. Joshi said the government has requested all parties, especially the opposition, for their cooperation for the smooth functioning of both Houses of Parliament. In order to build esprit de corps, PM Modi has invited presidents of all those parties who have an MP either in Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha for a meeting on June 19. The meeting has been called to discuss "one nation, one election" issue, celebrations of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, he said. It will be followed by a dinner meeting with all MPs of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha on June 20 to freely interact and exchange views with the government, Joshi said, adding that these two novel initiatives would go a long way in building team spirit among all parliamentarians. In Video:First session of 17th Lok Sabha starts on June 17Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi used the first all-party meeting called after the elections to push for his "One Nation, One Election" idea at a meeting of leaders of political parties to be held on June 19. Making the announcement at the usual meeting of political parties called on the eve of the 17th Lok Sabha convening on Monday, Modi said Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". Wednesday's meeting is to also discuss how Parliament can be made more productive. Modi's invite extends to presidents of all the parties with presence in Parliament. Besides "One Nation, One Election", the meeting would discuss celebration of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi said. 2 Maoists held for their role behind Len.description: NAGPUR: Two Maoist cadres, Dilip Hidami (22) and Parasram Tulavi (28), have been arrested by Gadchiroli police on Friday for their alleged role behind the blast at Lendhari nullah near Jambhulkheda that killed 15 Quick response team (QRT) and one civilian driver on May 1. Tulavi and Hidami, both residents of Lavhari, have been remanded to police custody for 12 days after they were produced before the court on Saturday. Police have seized substantial Maoists literature from the duo. Lavhari village is close to Jambhulkheda. Security forces had also launched search operations at Lavhari village after the blast but nothing had materialized then. Gadchiroli police had earlier arrested Dandakaranya special zonal committee (DKSZC) and Western sub-zonal member veteran Maoist cadre Narmadaakka and her husband Kiran Dada, who too had been occupying high rank in the outfit. The couple was arrested from Sironcha bus stop by Gadchiroli police with the help of their Telangana counterparts. It’s learnt that the names of Tulavi and Hidami had surfaced during the interrogation of Narmadaakka and Kiran Dada. Apart from interrogations, police have also used technical expertise to confirm their roles behind the arson and subsequently the blast. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nCultural fest organised at Chitnavis C.description: Nagpurians enjoyed an amazing collaboration of musical theatre along with a fusion of vocal and instrumental recitals at a cultural fest organised at Chitnavis Centre recently.  The event began with Charles Dickens’ English play — A Christmas Carol — directed by well-known city theatre artiste Vikash Khurana. The superlative performances, gripping storyline, peppy songs and a strong message of the play impressed the ardent theatre lovers of the city.  The ghazals rendered by Prasanna Joshi were no less impressive. An evidently elated guru of the singer Ustad Akeel Ahmed, sported a benign smile during the performance. Later, the instrumental fusion by maestros Salil Bhatt (on satvik veena) and Matthias Muller (on guitar) made for a befitting culmination to this cultural treat. Divisional commissioner Anoop Kumar and Maharashtra’s principal secretary (urban development), Manu Kumar Srivastava were spotted enjoying the cultural treat. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil.
