Mission Admission: Become a dentist, bri.description: Compared to many parts of the world, India is a sought-after destination to get that flawless smile at fraction of a cost. To ensure absolute health and hygiene, dental care is utterly necessary. Dentistry is one of the most desirable professions today. This profession deals with inspection and treatment of teeth, gums and other parts of the oral cavity. In carrying out treatment and surgeries, dentists get assistance from a number of people like dental hygienists, dental assistants, dental therapists and dental technicians. All of them collectively offer oral healthcare facilities and services. Dental health is an essential part of the overall health system. With modern lifestyle, dental problems are becoming common among all sections of society. This career profile is changing rapidly, creating many opportunities and challenges for job seekers. With increasing awareness about oral health and introduction of new fields like oral pathology, periodontics and orthodontics have enhanced the scope in this field. This career offers high wages and flexible work schedule. You also get the opportunity to be your own boss if you choose to start your own practice. Furthermore, this profession also to carry out computer and magnetic resonance imaging, implants, tissue grafts, trauma and laser surgery. Gagandeep Lamba, associate professor in the department of pediatric dentistry, said there are quite a few options for students after they complete their degree in Bachelor of Dental Surgery (BDS). She said, “Dentistry professionals can join any private hospital or clinic to work as a general dentist. Research in a pharmaceutical firm and working with armed forces are other great options. Dentists can go for post-graduation after their BDS by pursuing Masters in Dental Surgery (MDS).” Dentists in India have great job opportunities in nursing homes, hospitals, clinics and healthcare divisions of the government. They can be professors, lecturers, and associate professors in dental colleges. In addition, they can work as researchers in the pharmaceutical industry and other sectors manufacturing oral hygiene products and drugs such as mouthwash, toothpaste, and gum care products. BDS student Harshita Kumar said, “Every field is competitive and saturated. It depends on how well you educate yourself and practice in the years you undergo training. Gaining experience by joining dentistry internships and education programmes based on your specialization helps one go a long way.” Patience, concentration, accuracy and ability to stand for long hours are the basic qualities required for this career. If you have an eye for detail, manual dexterity, strong interpersonal and communication skills, then this is an ideal career option for you. The shifting paradigm of dentistry is evidently showing the predominance of women. Dentistry allows women flexibility with hours, office setup and administrative involvement. Many women tend to juggle more workload between their careers, families, homes, and communities. This field does not have emergencies except for accident cases. The duty hours are fixed so that women can work at different hours suitable for them. Also, even if you decide not to go for specialization after the BDS degree, you can establish yourself as a general dentist. It is better to join the course with a clear-cut idea about what your career options are after BDS. The multiple job options include those of a researcher, lecturer, Short Service Commissioned Officer in defense services etc. There are a few emerging specializations in the fields like forensic odontology, cosmetic surgery, laser and aesthetic dentistry. Building a successful dental practice takes hard work and dedication. Be it dentistry or any other profession, the field is bound to be competitive. You have to be on your toes always and ready to face challenges thrown your way. Hundreds and thousands of students pass every year. Government and private jobs cannot accommodate this ever-increasing number of graduates. The one who stands tall is ought to come out with flying colours. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rural police opt for DNA profiling in un.description: Nagpur: The rural police have sent samples for DNA profiling in the murder of an unidentified woman. The decomposed body of a naked and pregnant woman was found floating in a well at Ruikheri village near Bori on June 10. The body tied to two four-feet long cement poles was spotted by a villager, who alerted Bori police of Nagpur rural. A case of murder and destruction of evidence was registered against unidentified persons. A parallel probe into the murder was conducted by Bori police and Local Crime Branch (LCB). LCB sources said DNA samples of the pregnant woman and the eight-month-old embryo have been sent to the Regional Forensic Science Laboratory (RFSL) at Nagpur. Police said DNA sample of a woman from Chandrapur too has been sent for matching, as her daughter too has been missing after she eloped with a man some days ago. Police said the man, with whom the Chandrapur-based family’s daughter had eloped, too has kept his mobile phone switched off. Though the man is a native of Ballarshah, the missing complaint was registered at Chandrapur City police station by the family of the woman with whom he fled. “The Chandrapur-based family could not convincingly identify the deceased woman, as the dead body had swollen in the course of decomposition,’ said an officer involved in the probe. Sources from the rural police said the man seemed to have discarded his old hand set too, but he has been kept under scanner with technical surveillance system. “Our teams are camping and searching at different places in Chandrapur for the man who eloped with the woman. Though police are not sure whether the same man is the culprit, we need to find him to rule out his involvement,” said a senior officer. The missing complaints of similarly aged women from city and different districts too are being scanned. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Metro is running but has no stations to.description: NAGPUR: Even though three reaches of Nagpur Metro might become operational by mid-2020, it would take some months before all the stations become functional. Thus, in real sense, the project might be fully operational only in 2021. A source in MahaMetro said work on many stations was stuck due to land acquisition problems. "In the Sitabuldi to Khapri stretch, Ujjwal Nagar station is in trouble as land required on one side is stuck in litigation. Five stations are already operational on this reach while the remaining five will be gradually opened for the public by this year-end," he added. MahaMetro’s station contractor for this reach — ILFS — has gone bust leaving the work in limbo. The contracts were retendered and now work is on in full swing again. On Prajapati Nagar to Sitabuldi stretch, Prajapati Nagar station itself is stuck as the owner of Rehana Steel, whose land is required, is demanding a higher amount than that fixed by the district collector. "Negotiations are going on and we are trying to persuade the owner not to ask for a higher price," said the source. In general, work of this stretch (Reach IV) has been affected due to labour shortage. "Over 70% of construction workers employed for this reach are from outside. They had gone to their native villages to vote, and have started returning only just now. Work will begin in full swing only after some weeks when all of them are back on the job," the official said. The entire Reach II (Sitabuldi to Automotive Square stretch) is stuck since National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) is yet to sanction the double decker flyover on this stretch. The flyover was to begin from a point near SFS Church but due to opposition from locals it has been moved to LIC Square. However, four multi-storied buildings have to be acquired for it now. "We have stopped the work of most stations on Reach II as there is no clarity on the flyover. Work will begin only after NHAI gives the green signal," the source said. In addition, two stations have land problems too. "The owners of land on one side of Automotive Square station are not willing to hand it over. The Ambedkar Square station is stuck as there is legal dispute among family members over the ownership of the land," said the source. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nRaisoni College organises get-together.description: A get-together organised recently by the Raisoni College of Commerce, Science and Technology was high on fun and camaraderie.  The power-packed event had many entertaining acts and interesting games. Divided in different teams, students donned various superhero tees and brought forth their competitive streak in various games like truth or dare and musical chairs. Impromptu colourful dances, singing and humourous skits added entertainment to the do. The Raisonians, being the sport they are, performed all the tasks with great enthusiasm. The youngsters later were spotted clicking selfies and sharing light moments , bonding over refreshments. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur University okays contract teacher.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur University (NU) management council on Saturday finalized the process to appoint 107 assistant professors on contractual basis without approving the roster either by the government or the deputy divisional commissioner (revenue). Officials said the roster was approved by the vice chancellor using his special powers as per the Act. They said government or commissioner’s approval was not required since these posts were not regular. “The requirement keeps changing every year. Hence government approval is exempted as per a GR,” they said. This is the second year when the NU would be hiring teachers on contractual basis. Last year too, the NU’s move had attracted allegations of malpractices and violation of UGC norms. Though several objections were raised, the top brass went ahead with the appointments. On May 20, in its Board of Deans (BoD) meeting, presided over by pro-VC Pramod Yeole, the university decided to hire 107 teachers on 11-month contract where they would be paid remuneration of Rs24,000/month. The number has gone up by 15 compared to 92 last year. The teachers would work at 40 NU departments and conducted colleges, including Laxminarayan Institute of Technology (LIT), Sheshrao Wankhede BEd College and Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Law College. The moratorium on recruitment had been adversely affecting NU’s functioning. NU had received an overwhelming response with over 700 applications of which 432 were found eligible. Despite this, the appointment of 92 teachers last year was delayed by about six months. The actual teaching started from November end and the tenure concluded on April 30. NU officials said that the university was paying the teachers’ salaries from its general funds. Last year, management council members RG Bhoyar and Nitin Kongre had strongly opposed the move citing several shortcomings. They had said they were not against the filling up of 92 posts but only wanted the NU to reconsider its own norms which were in violation of UGC guidelines. The duo of Bhoyar-Kongre ripped apart the committee entrusted with framing the terms and conditions for the appointment and called the entire exercise as big illegality. Civic body allows Essel to take city\u20.description: Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has given permission to private operator Nagpur Solid Waste Processing and Management Private Ltd (NSWPMPL) for using city’s garbage in its Waste to Energy Plant situated in Jabalpur. The move is likely to create a controversy at the civic body. In its June 12 issue, TOI had reported that NSWPMPL, a company incorporated by the Noida-based Essel Infraprojects Limited and Japan-based Hitachi Zosan India Private Ltd brought a garbage segregation machine instead of installing the Waste to Energy Plant at the Bhandewadi dumping yard raising doubts whether the company will develop the city’s project or not. Project director of Essel Infraprojects Jeewan Sonwane had told TOI about the plan to transport the city’s garbage to the Jabalpur plant as the latter was not getting the required quantum of garbage over there. Mayor Nanda Jichkar and East Nagpur MLA Krishna Khopde dedicated the garbage segregation machine to the public on Sunday. NMC additional municipal commissioner Ram Joshi confirmed to TOI about the permission given to the operator for using the city’s garbage in the Jabalpur plant. “The operator has been given 10 acres of land for the project. Garbage was lying on this land and needed to be shifted. The operator had shifted garbage from some area. Now, the process to shift garbage from the remaining area is under way. Permission is in the contract itself to shift garbage lying on the project’s land. The operator cannot take the day-to-day garbage to Jabalpur and to establish the plant,” he said. As per the agreement, the NMC will pay Rs 70 crore to the operator for developing the project, pay tipping charges for treating 800 tonnes of garbage per day, producing 11.5MW power and disposing waste content by developing the landfill site. The move will create a controversy if the operator is paid everything for taking garbage to Jabalpur and not developing all systems here. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Charm of old songs leaves lasting impact.description: Nagpur: The air was filled with nostalgia as music lovers took a stroll down memory lane and swayed to the tunes of retro songs at a programme titled ‘Barkha Rani Zara Jamke Barso’, organized by Swarmilan at Utkarsh Hall, Mor Hindi Bhavan, Sitabuldi on Friday. The programme commenced with the recitation of Saraswati and Ganesh vandana. The singers were Anjali Wankhede, Kranti Bhagat, Padma Murty, Jayanti Prasad, Poonam Sharma, Alka Thakur, CY Raipure, Padmakar Maske, Sangeeta Kannamwar, Bhagyashree Kulkarni, Arti Rajkondawar, Meera Sharma, Piyush Shinde, Sudhir Pillay, Vidya Mankawde, Mangesh Pawar, AN Sharma, TK Balakrishnan, Jaya Dhabekar, Rohini Patra, Soni Patra and Rajesh Naik. The programme started with Sangita Kannamwar presenting ‘Sawan ka mahina’, followed by Vidya Mankawde’s ‘Ruperi valut madanchya banat ye na’. Mangesh Pawar sang ‘Yeh sham mastani’. Arti Rajkondawar and TK Balakrishnan sang ‘Kaho na pyar hai’ while Bhagyashree and CY Raipure ‘Ik manzil raahi do’. Padma Murty and Poonam Sharma presented mind-blowing song ‘Kajra mohabbat wala’ while Meera Sharma performed ‘Bole re papihara’. Songs like ‘Tere bina zindagi se koi’, Chori chori koi aaye’, ‘Lambi judai’, ‘Zindagi aa raha hu mai’, ‘Jab deep jale aana’ and ‘Tere bina zindagi se koi’ which prompted the audience tap their feet in appreciation of singers. Title song ‘Barkha rani zara jamke baraso’ was sung by CY Raipure. Anchor Om Prakash Sahu shared some anecdotes about songs and why their melody continues to attract people. Sanjay Pillay, organizers of the show, said, “Our group’s main aim is to give talented singers a platform who have a passion for singing. Quotes The experience of reliving the old songs was surreal. It was mesmerizing to hear such amazing songs again. The singers were very talented as well. Over all, this was a very good experience Preeti Rao | I had not expected the event to be such a success. It was fun filled, it was musical, but most of all, people enjoyed and that is what mattered the most. As for me, it was refreshing to listen to amazing songs once again. I am glad I came Ritesh Singh | Songs have a special ability to take you back in time and make you forget everything else. This was one of those events which made you want to be happy and get lost in the moment. I enjoyed myself a lot Suman Tiwari | (Reporting by Pushkar Singh & Shristi Sankrit) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Std III student, teenager raped in separ.description: Nagpur: Two cases of rape, including one of a minor, were reported at different police stations in the city on Friday. In the both the cases, police have arrested the accused under sections of Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.In the first incident, a seven-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her neighbour Ravikant Hadke who lured the survivor to a garden on the pretext of playing with his son and his niece. Police said the survivor, a student of Std III, is a friend of Hadke’s niece and used to go to his home for playing. Hadke, who works as a computer operator at a private hospital, used to take his son, his niece and the survivor to play in a garden near their house. Between May 20 and June 3, the accused allegedly exploited the survivor in the garden.The accused also threatened the survivor of dire consequences if she told anyone about the incident. The afraid survivor did not tell her mother about the incident but used to complain of pain in her private parts.Around 10 days later, the survivor’s mother forced her to open up after which she shared her ordeal. The survivor’s parents then approached MIDC police station and filed a complaint. Police soon arrested the accused.In another incident, 19-year-old teenager was allegedly exploited for several months by her former beau by luring her with fake marriage promises. The accused, identified as Mohit Desai, exploited the teenager between November 2018 and June this year.Police said Mohit, who has affiliations to a political party, came in contact with the survivor through social media platform. The duo started chatting and their friendship bloomed into a relationship soon. During that period Mohit took the survivor to his friend’s house at Chhaoni and exploited her.After several such encounters, the survivor asked Mohit to marry her but he refused and also abused her. The survivor then approached Sadar police station and filed a complaint. Cops soon arrested the accused.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Buldhana water crisis: Drought times, de.description: BULDHANA: The last they remember that it rained well was in 2012, say locals in the hinterland here. At Buldhana, the westernmost district of Vidarbha region, dry spells are now not new, and have only worsened by the year. As the drought is at its peak in 2019, a trip across 300km, covering scores of villages, revealed a district gradually heading towards a socio-economic crisis of a new type. Seven years of deficient rains have quietly aggravated migration in the district as profits from farms have shrunk, and also reduced jobs for farm hands. This has gone unnoticed among the powers that be. Officials brush off the migration as normal seasonal movement towards the cities. A cross section of locals TOI contacted in three talukas of the district say recurring droughts are forcing many to even quit farming and work as cheap labour, living in sub-human conditions in cities like Mumbai, Pune, Nashik, and even Surat and Vadodara in Gujarat. Even earlier, people had been moving to the cities from Buldhana to return during sowing seasons. But the numbers have gone up substantially in last 2-3 years only because the series of droughts have made life tough back in the district, say locals. The Indian meteorological department (IMD) website marks Buldhana and other parts of Vidarbha as large deficient area for the year. What began with the landless workers leaving has now ended with even small and marginal farmers leaving their homes and hearth, abandoning their fields. At Isoli village, over 45km from Khamgaon tehsil, its dark and a group of villagers are waiting to a catch a transport till the bus stop 15km away. They are all heading for Pune, some had already settled there and were going back after a short visit. Sanjay Warkad finally decided to leave the village three months ago, and wants to work as a security guard in a housing colony. Warkad, who had come to take his family, including aged parents along, leaves behind a four acre farm. “With barely any rains and wild animals damaging the crop, its meaningless to stay here anymore. What I earn by farming in a year may be I’ll get in a few months as a guard. With so much construction activity there are many jobs in Pune,” he said. Warkad is not alone. According to Panchayat Samiti members almost 500 acre have been abandoned in Isoli and around as people have left the village. Close by, the Dhavale family is in mourning. A week ago, 23-year-old Maruti Dhavale was murdered in Pune, where he had been working for the last two years. “We keep getting news of people getting killed in accidents in Pune or Mumbai,” said Amol Pakhare, a local leader. “It’s not that there was no migration in Buldhana when times were good, but certainly the trend has gone up substantially and repeated droughts are the factor,” added Pakhare, a BJP worker. There is a mini-Buldhana in localities like Balewadi at Pune. There are similar localities in Surat, and Vadodara. “Muslims prefer going to Surat or Vadodara, and the Hindus head towards Mumbai or Pune. This is purely because they join their friends already settled there. Many butchers who have shifted to Mumbai are doing the same work there,” said Mobin Shaikh, deputy sarpanch at Isoli. “Life is bad as they live in cramped rooms in the slums, sharing space with anti-social elements. Dhavale’s murder following a brawl depicts the conditions,” said Samadhan Supekar. “The migrations are a direct impact of agriculture taking a hit. The big farmers have scaled down their operations due to lack of water. This has cut the demand for farm hands too. Now, even small and marginal farmer, who would supplement their income by working as farm labourers have preferred to leave,” said Vallabh Deshmukh, a director of Maharashtra Seeds Corporation at Amdapur, 15km from Isoli. The Brahmanwada reservoir near the village last filled up in 2006. Since then, the water has only depleted to finally dry up now, and the village is depending on tankers, he said. At Ganeshpur, further towards Khamgaon, Devidas Thatekwar says usually workers who used to leave to harvest sugar cane in West Maharashtra have not returned. In last three years, there has been a major outflow, said Devidas Thatewar. Each village TOI went to had seen at least 20-30 people leaving this year. The story is no different even more than 70km away at Chicholi village in Shegaon taluka. “Farm wages have shrunk to Rs60 a day, so workers can get slightly better wages in a big city, which is prompting many to go,” said Gopal Dhage in Chicholi village. Earlier, when there was no drought, members of the Matang community, who make a living by picking scrap, used to go to Mumbai. As life became tough for farmers in last four years, others also sought references from the Matangs to work in Mumbai, said Dhage. NO OFFICIAL RECORD OF MIGRATIONS A senior official in the district collector’s office said no agency has reported drought related migrations, and said even locals have not pointed out such development. The district administration is already employing over 10,600 persons in more than 1,200 works. It’s ready to employ another 2.5 lakh workers on the basis of requisitions from gram panchayats, said a source. Works under the chief minister’s Jalyukta Shivar scheme were also taken up during the last few years; at 330 villages in 2015-16, 194 villages in 2016-17, and 205 in 2018-19. However, due to lack of rains, there was little scope for water harvesting, said a source. Collector Dr Nirupama Dange could not be contacted despite repeated attempts. RAIN FIGURES TELL THEIR OWN TALE According to data recorded in state government’s maharain.gov.in portal, since 2000, Buldhana has received rainfall below the normal mark in 11 years. The worse has been 2018, when the rainfall was 44% below the normal 668mm. Even after considering five years of excess rainfall, when it poured in the range of 845 to 946mm, the average since 2000 comes below the normal level by 3%. The average of the 11 years when it rained less is 19% below the normal level. This just a per cent less than the large deficit definition of IMD. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Varsity brings in new engg syllabus over.description: NAGPUR: Sitting over it for over one and half years, the Nagpur University (NU) has suddenly decided to implement the model All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) curriculum from this academic year after a mere two-hours discussion over lunch. Questions have been raised over NU’s move since none of the stakeholders was informed about it even as the new academic year is set to start in a couple of weeks. While concerns have been raised over damage a hurriedly prepared syllabus may leave on NU’s engineering education, this year’s aspirants would be at a loss of not knowing the entire four-year syllabus. Last week, the proposal was tabled before the Board of Studies (BoS) to clear the move when one of the members reflagged it and demanded an elaborate deliberation. So far, only the first-year syllabus has been formulated. Mahendra Chaudhary, who is a BoS Applied Science and Humanities as well as Senate member, was shocked to know about the proposal. He refused to sign the proposal until the BoS allowed discussion on the new syllabus. “I wrote to the vice chancellor expressing my concerns. We need to think about students from the region. The AICTE curriculum is meant for IIT-level students while our colleges have 45 percenters enrolled with them. Ideally, there should be been discussion spread over months. But, now at least faculty members need to be informed through some initiative,” Chaudhary said. On his demand, the NU has agreed to organize workshops, which too has been alleged as a futile exercise. “The discussion is on the proposed syllabus which means the already decided one would be implemented. Only a handful of engineering faculty members were invited to formulate this new syllabus which is not in accordance with AICTE norms,” some teachers told TOI. The discussions to be held at different colleges from Monday have been dubbed as eyewash since it would deliberate on the syllabus for just over two hours. As per the workshop schedule, the discussion would taken up after lunch between 2.30pm and 4.30pm. Those opposed to NU’s abrupt move wanted involvement of all stakeholders since the start. Stakeholders involve parents, students’ representatives, industry professionals, academicians apart from university officials and members. Surprisingly, the NU has kept the entire affair under wraps as it never bothered to invite suggestions and objections from stakeholders in the last one and half years. The AICTE had introduced the model curriculum in January 2018. The NU also never uploaded a single document or meeting notice on its website about the move. University’s Vice chancellor SP Kane didn’t respond to TOI’s calls and SMS. The new curriculum envisages more weightage to region specific and skill-based learning. Over 60 credits too have been cut to encourage industry internships. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Various hues of life depicted in 10 play.description: NAGPUR: Humour, satire and emotions which are inseparable part of life were on display during the ten plays presented in Sugar and Spice round IX, organized by Stagecraft at Matoshri Vimlatai Deshmukh Sabhagruh, Dhanwate National College, on Saturday. The event started with an emotional thought-provoking drama ‘Meri Dadi Kahan Hai’, directed by Anurima Chakraborty. The play is about a little girl Khushi Mohta who is in search of her grandmother (Jigyasa Bharti). In the process, the girl takes help from an autowala, rabbit, dog, tortoise, lion and bear. The actors were Samvardhan Khandelwal, Ismat Chimthanawala, Viraj Shah, Arundhati Jogdand, Rahul Bhojwani and Pratiksha Kaleshwarwar. The play was written by Padmashree Pande. ‘Happy Meal’, directed by Shivani Joshi and written by Shubhankar Mishra, was full of humour. A girl (Devika Patel) and her friend (Amol Wakhare) have a magic apple through which they can go to any place they wish to. But as an argument ensues, the girl throws away the apple. They are now stuck on a cold mountain peak, but then mother comes to their rescue and gives them a mango through which they can travel even to outer space. ‘Ek Chhoti Si Khwaish’, a satire on the condition of a student, written by Raunak Madne and directed by Anu Sabharwal, tells the story of a girl (Ruhi Khanuja) who is burdened by the wishes of her mother (Anurima Chakraborty) to become a doctor. But her teacher (Anurima Chakraborty) thinks she is dumb. The girl struggles to fulfil her mother’s dream but eventually ends up into depression. ‘Conversations’, directed by Rajat Rajani, dealt with standing up for self and being proud of who you are, was about a young woman (Ayushi Vairagade) opening up to her mother (Maria Shakir) and sister (Avni Jog) being gay. Harshit Verma played the role of a waiter. ‘Chidiya Udd’ was a satire on how today’s generation has lost childhood under the burden of tuition classes and extra-curricular activities. The play, written by Nitish Chandra, was directed by NV Sharma. The cast included Tahir Shibam, Swati Lohe, Riddhi Lohe and Huzefa Kotawala. Another satire, ‘Three Monkeys & A Like Button’ was based on how our life is being directed by a ‘like’ button of Facebook. The play was written by Jaya Girathe and directed by Maria Shakir. The cast included Shaima Patel, Neelam Singh and Manank Panchmatia. Emotional play ‘Remembering My Grandmother’ was written by Jaee Jog and directed by Neha Khanzode. The cast included Nivedita Jogdand, Shivani Joshi and Rahul Bhojwani. ‘Nowhere to Play’, written by Bianca Nazareth-Arya and directed by Sonal Bindra, was a satire on how children today do not have a place to play. The cast included Vardaan Anand, Parthiv Banerjee, Harsh Dayaramani and Anu Sabharwal. ‘Loose’ was about how if our parents become care free and never tell us to study and let us do as we wish. The play was written by Onkar Ghare and directed by Sanskruti Bajoria. Shika Kalra, Madhvi Ambhore and Kuldeep Lohe were the actors. Audience laughed heartily when ‘Andher Nagri Chopat Raja’, written by Shantanu Thengdi and directed by Taher Shibam, was staged. The cast included Samson Aiyub, Shlok Vij, Lalit Ghavghave, Ashwin Shukla, Namrata Shukla, Manank Panchmatia, Sana Thombre and Shubham Veergandham. Lalit. Ghavghave stole the show with his quick wit. (Reporting by Himesh Pande) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nJohn Abraham, Varun Dhawan and Jacquel.description: When a fan challenged Varun Dhawan to lift his 'Dishoom' co-star John Abraham, he sportingly did so at a college event in Nagpur. Later, at a media event in Nagpur, Varun Dhawan challenged Jacqueline Fernandez to lift John Abraham. The actress surprised everyone with her sincere attempt. But John proved to be the real ‘Hulk’ as he scooped Varun in his arms, while Jacqueline piggybacked. Talk about muscle power! Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tiger kills daily wager in Chanda.description: CHANDRAPUR: A tiger on Friday killed a daily wage forest labourer ay Gunjewahi forest in Sidewahi range while he was out on routine patrolling duty. Official sources said that the victim, Ashok Choudhari from Gujewahi, used to work as labourer for the forest department. After he failed to return home till late in the evening, his family members and villagers went out in his search only to recover his dead body in the forest. People living in Sidewahi range have been reeling under predator terror as four persons have been killed in the last 15 days. Two persons were killed in a leopard attack at Gadbori, while two others, including Choudhari, were killed in separate tiger attacks. Forest officials claimed that they have given Rs30,000 cash and a cheque for Rs2.7 lakh as ex-gratia to the victim’s family. The remaining compensation will be paid to his kin after documental formalities. As many as 16 people have been killed in predator attacks in so far this year in Chandrapur district. Out of these, 14 are victims of tiger attacks, while other two have been killed by leopards. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Singers regale music lovers at \u2018Kar.description: Nagpur: ‘Karva Suron Ka’, a programme of music organized by Cloud 9 Entertainment and 7 Notes Vocal Training Institute, had the audience in thrall as singers presented quality numbers at Dhanwate Sabhagruh on Saturday. The event started with a dance and singing group performance on the song ‘Albela sajan aayo re’, presented by Shyam Bapte, Nitesh Chare, Akanksha Chaudhary, Sampada Borkar, Pranjal Loya, Pooja Tol, Samvedana Ahre and Ujwal Kapde. The event had many famous songs like ‘Madhuban mein Radhika nache re’ by Shyam Bapte, ‘Chalte chalte mere yeh geet yaad rakhna’ by Adarsh Shrivastava and ‘Pal pal dil ke paas tum rehti ho’ by Milind Kulkarni which entertained music lovers. Evergreen songs like ‘Yeh mera prem patra padhkar’ by Dhananjay, ‘Kahi dur jab din dhal jaye’ by Mohan, ‘Pukarta chala hu main’ by Shridhar Mude, ‘Dum dum diga diga mausam bheega bheega’ by Sanjay Pularwar, ‘Surmai akhiyon mai’ by Prassana Nair, ‘Aye mere dil kahi aur chal’ by Shekhar Nimkhedkar, ‘Ek pyaar ka nagma hai’ by Sejal, ‘Kisi ki muskurahato pe ho nisaar’ by Dhananjay, ‘Lakho hai nigah main’ by Shridhar Mude, ‘Bulleya’ by Ujwal Kapde, ‘pal pal dil ke pass tum rehti ho’ by Milind. Videos of songs playing in the background was an added attraction. Singers from all age groups, from small children to elders, regaled the spectators with impressive presentation of hit songs. Earlier, chief guests Vishnu Manohar, Rakesh Samarth, Vijay Jate and Nandu Andhare lit the traditional lamp to mark the inauguration of the programme. Mukul Pande, who organized the event, has been in music industry for the last 15 years and has performed in cities like Pune, Mumbai, Kolkata, Hyderabad and Nagpur. 7 Notes Vocal Training Institute, established a year back, has 28 students. The main focus of the institute is to teach students proper ‘swar, taal and lay’. Experts the also teach how to use different instruments as well. Attention is paid that students of music learn from mistakes so that they could perform well during the programme. Anchor of the show shared many interesting facts, especially about songs based on classical music. The anchor said classical music is the pride of Indian culture which takes years to master the craft. Giving examples, the anchor said classical music should be taught since early age under the guidance of a guru. A short film on the raining institute was screened in which various vocal techniques were showed. Glimpses of the events organized earlier were also shown. Some of the singers shared their learning experience at the institute. Quotes The singers had done homework well and presented songs beautifully. The organizers of the show also did a wonderful job Satish Bais | businessman The selection of songs was good. Celebrated song ‘Ajeeb dastan hai yeh’ from movie ‘Dil Apna Aur Preet Paria’ was presented very nicely Divya Shrivastav | accountant Though singers sang beautifully, I liked the way the little kids were singing and their expressions were impressive Naresh Gacchakayala | government employee (Reporting by Pushkar Singh and Prajyot Deoghare) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. \nGovernment Chitrakala Mahavidyalaya ho.description: There was a flurry of excitement among the students and teaching staff of Government Chitrakala Mahavidyalaya at their recently organised cultural fiesta —Aakar—where everyone enjoyed cultural treats, entertaining acts and fun-filled competitions. The discerning audience enjoyed a fine bouquet of performing arts and shared a good time interacting with one another on this occasion.  “This fest is a melting pot of various art forms and the students have been given a great platform by the college to exhibit their talent. From traditional dance performances to skits, mono acts, painting exhibitions to food stalls, there was a fine mix of everything for people to enjoy,” said lecturer Kishore Ingale.  We spotted principal of the college Vinod Mankar and educationists Subhash Babhulkar, Vikash Joshi, Rakesh Pathrabe and Rajendra Giri having a good time at the fiesta. Sikh beaten in Delhi.description: NEW DELHI: There was high drama in north Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar on Sunday evening when a group of policemen clashed with a Gramin Sewa driver and his son, a minor. The incident was captured by passersby on mobile phone and the footage went viral. In the video, a few policemen were seen hitting the driver with sticks and then kicking him. The man was later detained. However, Delhi Police, in a statement, claimed that the incident took place after the driver hit a police van and started arguing with cops. Things took a turn for the worse as the driver then allegedly pulled out a sword and assaulted an on-duty officer. While trying to escape from the spot, the accused hit another cop with his vehicle, police said. Later, the policemen chased the vehicle and forced the driver to stop. The juvenile son of the driver also joined the argument, they said. In another video of the incident, the driver was seen arguing with a cop while holding a sword. An inquiry has been initiated into the incident. Meanwhile, five people, including two women, were arrested for assaulting cops who tried to intervene in a fight near Tibia college in central Delhi. The incident happened on Friday evening. CCTV footage was being checked to ascertain the exact sequence of events, police said. Facebook live records accident; two dead.description: Nagpur: A joyride turn tragic after two brothers who were on their way to a pool party at a farm house in Katol died while seven others were injured after the SUV they were travelling in met with an accident on Sunday evening near Hatlagaon. The incident was also recorded in a video as the youths were sharing a live feed on Facebook while they were on their way to the party. All the nine friends were on way to attend a party in Katol from city when the incident happened The video procured by TOI shows, Punkesh Patil, 25, driving the car while his brother Sanket was sitting beside him. One of his friends, sitting on back seat, was recording the video of the route as a rap song was playing in the background. The video shows Punkesh was trying to overtake a car which was already overtaking another car. It had led the SUV to the far right side of the road, before Punkesh lost control and the SUV met with an accident. According to police, Punkesh lost the control of the speeding SUV due to which it went on the far right of the road before it summer salted twice before hitting a tree. The incident was spotted by several villagers who soon informed police control room. Katol police rushed to the spot and sent the injured to hospital while both the brothers died on spot. Till late night, police had not registered any offence in the matter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

"Another strike on Pakistan by team India and the result is the same. Congratulations to the entire team for this superb performance. Every Indian is feeling proud and celebrating this impressive win," Shah said in a tweet. Another strike on Pakistan by #TeamIndia and the result is same. Wait until mid-2020 for full Metro ride.description: NAGPUR: After declaring several times that Nagpur Metro project would be completed by December, 2019, MahaMetro has now revised the deadline to mid-2020. This too is subject to National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) clearing the Kamptee Road stretch within a few days. MahaMetro has to construct a double decker flyover from Gaddigodam to Automotive Square. The starting point of the flyover is a bone of contention with the locals opposing the initial location. MahaMetro decided to shift it to LIC Square but NHAI has put a rider that it needs 5.5 metre wide service road. The Metro agency will have to demolish four multi-storied buildings for this. Union transport minister Nitin Gadkari has been approached to sort out the issue. The agency does not agree that it is a delay. “As per the detailed project report (DPR), the project is to be completed in five years from the date of beginning of construction. Work on the project began on May 31, 2015. So we have time till June, 2020,” said a spokesperson. As on date, only one out of the four reaches is operational, that too not fully. Only five out of 11 stations are operating on Sitabuldi-Khapri stretch (Reach I). Only six trains each are plying in both directions on this route. According to MahaMetro spokesperson, frequency of trains on Reach I will increase this month. “We successfully tested the down line of Reach I on June 4. Now, trains will run on both up and down lines. Moreover, 15 more coaches are slated to reach Nagpur this month. We will be able to run more trains gradually,” he said. As for remaining six stations of Reach I — Congress Nagar, Rahate Colony, Ajni Square, Jaiprakash Nagar, Chhatrapati Nagar and Ujjwal Nagar — all of them will be operational by the year end. This will be a gradual process, he added. MahaMetro is supposed to launch a common mobility card for Metro, city buses, feeder vehicles, autorickshaws etc. However, so far the card — Mahacard — has been launched with limited features, for travelling in Nagpur Metro only. It has been distributed among commuters. As the Mahacard is EMV (Europay, Mastercard and Visa) based bank card it has to pass through extensive internal testing, third party audit and security review. “MahaMetro is in touch with State Bank of India (SBI) and as per the current planning and discussions, the card is expected to be launched within a month or so,” said the spokesperson. The feeder services are yet to start fully. The operator for the service of bicycles, e-bicycles and e-scooters is Wicked Ride Adventure Services (Bounce). The service has been started on monthly subscription basis. The e-scooter service will start after getting permission from the state transport department. Feeder buses have been started by Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) for some stations. According to the spokesperson, hundreds of people working in Mihan live in Besa-Beltarodi. “NMC runs buses from Besa to Airport South and then from Khapri to Mihan. City bus and Metro timetables have been displayed on company notice boards,” he said. There are very few amenities at the Metro stations. The spokesperson said that tenders for small business spaces at Airport, Khapri and Jaiprakash Nagar stations have been floated and necessary services would be available after the process was completed. Khapri and New Airport stations lack approach roads. According to the spokesperson approach road to them is available at Mihan end but these are not tarred roads and in very bad shape. “Approach road to New Airport station from Wardha Road side will be ready in a couple of months,” he added. Next in the pipeline is commercial operation of Reach III. Work on the entire stretch will be over by July end and trains will start plying in August. Here too only five stations will operate initially — Lokmanya Nagar, Subhash Nagar, Institution of Engineers, Rani Jhansi Square and Sitabuldi Interchange. The remaining stations will be opened up one after another in six to seven months. Reach II (Sitabuldi to Automotive Square) and Reach IV (Sitabuldi to Prajapati Nagar) will be completed in the first quarter of 2020. Work on Reach II is 50% complete, piling work 96%, pile cap 85%, pier 76%, segment casting 33% and Metro station work 54%. Girder launching is progressing. Work on Reach IV is also 50% complete. According to MahaMetro the viaduct is 67% complete, pilling 97%, pile cap 95%, pier 76%, segment casting 78% and segment erection 63% has been completed. Contractors were supposed to finish the work by December 2019. However, this is not happening. On whether they will be penalized, the spokesperson said, “Entire Reach II is stuck up due to NHAI. As for other three reaches many stations are stuck up as we are to acquire private land for them. The contractors can be punished only if they do not complete the job even after getting possession of entire land.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Regularly review services, GMC deans tol.description: NAGPUR: Secretary of Medical Education and Drugs Department, Dr Sanjay Mukherjee, has asked deans of all government medical colleges (GMCs) in the state to regularly review situation of patients and resident doctors in every department. These instructions, given through a correspondence earlier last week, came following recent assaults on resident doctors in West Bengal. These instructions are important, especially in case of Nagpur as both the GMCs in city are overburdened with patient load. Recently, an incident of assault on doctors and a complaint about inadequate services in the delivery ward were reported at Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH). Dean of one of the GMCs in Nagpur confirmed that he has received the letter. “We have been asked to be more alert and conduct our periodical reviews without fail. Accordingly, all necessary instructions have been issued to the department heads,” he said. The letter further states that senior doctors and technicians must remain present in hospitals during their duty timings, especially in case of indoor patient treatment. It also directs seniors as well as resident doctors to improve communication with patients and avoid clashes. Deans in medical colleges in Yavatmal, Akola, and Chandrapur have also received the correspondence. More than 14 women admitted in maternity ward at Yavatmal GMC had suffered surgical infections in April this year. As these medical colleges gets plenty of patients from the peripheral areas, deans have been asked to give additional attention towards communication between residents and rural patients. Dist gets third minister as Fuke becomes.description: Nagpur: Hard work done for winning the Bhandara-Gondia Lok Sabha seat for BJP has paid off for MLC Parinay Fuke (a resident of Nagpur) as he has been appointed a minister of state by chief minister Devendra Fadnavis. He is the third minister from the district after the CM and energy minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule. He has been allocated the public works, tribal development and forest portfolios. Although Fuke will be a minister only till October, when assembly elections are scheduled, this appointment brightens his chance of becoming a minister in the new government should BJP-Shiv Sena retain power. Fuke started his political journey in 2007 when he was elected as an independent corporator. Between 2007 and 2012, he was in the opposition benches. However, he continued his close relationship with Fadnavis, who was then just a BJP MLA. After winning the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) election second time in 2012 he moved closer to BJP by joining the saffron party led Nagpur Vikas Aghadi. In 2016 he formally joined BJP and contested the legislative council elections from Bhandara-Gondia local body seat. He soundly defeated Rajendra Jain, a close aide of NCP stalwart Praful Patel. He managed to get a BJP ticket for NMC elections in 2017 and ensured his victory. Even though Fuke joined BJP in 2016 he was closely associated with Fadnavis since years. He help the CM during Vidhan Sabha elections in 2009 and 2014. Even while in the opposition in NMC, he rarely took an antigovernment stand and was considered to be a neutral. Fuke’s career in BJP received a boost when the then MP Nana Patole from Bhandara-Gondia quit the party in 2017 and joined Congress. The MLC emerged from Patole’s shadow to become a prominent leader in the two districts. The MLC had to bite dust when BJP lost the Lok Sabha assembly election from the constituency in May 2018. Patole and Patel had joined hands in the bypoll to ensure victory of their candidate Madhukar Kukde. Fuke however, did not lose heart and along with Bawankule he charged up the party workers for the general elections. Most political pundits felt that NCP would win from Bhandara-Gondia as BJP had lost the bypoll. However, the saffron candidate Sunil Mendhe won by 1.97 lakh votes giving a big boost to Fuke’s career. In fact Fuke had been offered the ticket but he refused. Fuke’s close association with TOI-MT Parinay Fuke was closely associated with TOI-MT during the Nag River campaign. He tabled a proposal in NMC House to name the square near TOI-MT office as ‘Times Square’. He then followed up with the administration to ensure that the proposal was implemented. Fuke got the road divider from Times Square to Laxmi Bhuvan Square painted and repaired the Nag River wall near TOI-MT office. He also helped the Group during its ‘Happy Streets’ event. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Bhagwat raps Mamata for Bengal violence,.description: Nagpur: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat obliquely hit out at West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee for the post election violence in the state which has left BJP workers killed. Addressing the annual passing out parade of the final year course of RSS workers on Sunday, Bhagwat said the violence was unacceptable and animosity should have ended with the elections. “Each one should work together for the country’s development,” he said. In his first major public speech after general elections, Bhagwat who made sharp remarks at opposition, however, also cautioned the ruling party against being complacent. Without naming BJP or any other party, he said the “people have bought them to power again hoping that certain aspirations which were left out in the last tenure will be met now. So, it is the utmost duty of those in power to live up to the people’s expectations.” “The public has become wiser these days and does not get carried away by political promises. This time the people have voted cutting across the divides of society,” he said. This year’s annual passing out ceremony of the RSS remained a rather low-key affair with no chief guest from outside the organization sharing the dais. Last year, veteran Congressman and former President Pranab Mukherjee was the chief guest. This had led to a political stir. This time business baron Rata Tata was invited who did not make it to the function. “The party which has come to power has got a stronger mandate in the fresh tenure. This means the people have reposed higher faith in the party. Some of the promises they had made were kept and some remained to be fulfilled,” he said. “It seems that some have not been able to digest their defeat. Look at what is taking place in Bengal. It is the responsibility of those at the helm to prevent such happenings. Those who have lost should take the defeat sportingly and the winners should also not be taken over by pride,” said Bhagwat. “It’s perhaps the fear of losing the next elections that has led to violence against political workers. After all these are just elections in which parties only compete to win people’s mandate and this is no war where any bloodshed takes place,” he said. Saying that certain elements are trying to divide the nation for their vested interests, Bhagwat said if they succeed, what was achieved after 70 years of Independence would be wiped out soon. He warned the ruling party of the Trojan horse in the hiding. Bhagwat also evoked Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar citing that he had stressed brotherhood was the need of hour to keep the freedom intact. “Both freedom and equality cannot come in equal measure. To maintain a balance between the two what the country needed was brotherhood,” he said citing Ambedkar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nTheatre connoisseurs enjoy the thrills.description: Enid Blyton’s classic English story— Five on a Treasure Island — from the famous five series was recently staged as a play in the city and it received great response from the theatre lovers. The play was directed by Vikash Khurana and had many thrilling and adventurous moments coupled with timely humour to keep the audience’s interest levels intact till the end. The young actors delighted the discerning audience with their performances and Khurana’s role as an antagonist was also appreciated by everyone. When we asked the director whether he had any inhibitions prior to the staging of the play, he said, “My biggest concern was to incorporate various scenes from the play on a small stage, but with proper planning, we managed to transcend the audience to Kirrin Island and the English countryside where the story is set.” We saw educationist Dr Dipti Christian and theatre person Aditya Bansod enjoying the theatrical treat with their friends.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

RPF to seek IRCTC help to nab ticketing.description: NAGPUR: The Railway Protection Force (RPF), Central Railway, may seek assistance of the Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) to nail the ticketing agents operating illegally using fake IDs to earn extra commission. In the last few months, RPF across the nation has repeatedly raided ticketing agents who have been using multiple fake IDs to make tickets to make commission, depriving the masses who fail to get through the system technically hijacked by the wrong doers. RPF, especially that of Central Railway, had also exposed agents using special software to make tickets within short period using several IDs flouting the norms of IRCTC. Senior divisional security commissioner, Central Railway, Bhawani Shankar Nath said he has urged his team to approach IRCTC to furnish them the records of such agents and IDs which are being excessively used to purchase online tickets. “We are hoping to get list of the IDs which are repeatedly being used over a period of three months as a period taken for observation. The raids would be conducted according to our analysis,” he said. Nath said simultaneous raids would be conducted once the flouting agents are shortlisted. On Thursday, RPF conducted raids at 338 places in 205 cities, including 15 in Nagpur, seizing tickets worth more than Rs4.2 crore. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Goon let off by IPS officer in Jan 2018.description: NAGPUR: Swapnil Salunkhe was arrested from Kamal Chowk on June 13 in connection with an assault on cops on December 26, 2017. Ironically, he had earlier been allegedly allowed to walk away from custody in the same case, on the intervention of an IPS officer in January 2018. He was sent to magisterial custody on June 15 by the court. Salunkhe, earlier an accused in a murder where Maharashtra Control of Organized Crime Act (MCOCA) was invoked, is learnt to be a close associate of dreaded Ippa gang. He had been booked in a case of assault on cops in an incident of December 26 in 2017. The offence against Salunkhe and 10 others, including gangster Ippa’s brothers Naushad and Irshad, was registered at Pachpaoli police station. On December 26, 2017, cops had gone to arrest members of the Ippa gang near the railway tracks adjoining Nova Company at Motibagh in connection with a case of attempt to murder registered at Tehsil police station for attacking a rival the previous day. The gangsters had managed to flee after showering bricks on crime branch cops and also damaging their vehicle. MCOCA was invoked against the Ippa gang in the offence registered at Tehsil police station but questionable intervention of senior officers led to removal of a goon’s name from the charge sheet. The goon’s kin is allegedly close to a senior politician from city. Salunkhe was rounded up by crime branch’s unit number three and taken to their Lakdapool police chowky in January last year. Unconfirmed sources claimed that while recording his statement crime branch officials received a call from a top police officer. After this Salunkhe was been let off. A senior IPS officer had told TOI that Salunkhe was not present at the site as per his cell phone location and other evidence, which prompted the decision to let him go from custody. After that, police have till date been unable to trace the Ippa brothers Naushad and Irshad. Salunkhe too had been let off. With crucial arrests pending, the charge sheet could not be sent in the case. Sub-inspector Anant Wadatkar of Pachpaoli police station said the charge sheet would be sent soon now. “There was adequate evidence against Salunkhe for police to arrest him. There were statements of witnesses and other details which justified his arrest,” said Wadatkar. “Salunkhe also had cases of murder and three to four other offences against him,” he said. Wadatkar, skirting controversies, said Salunkhe had managed to flee from Lakdapool and no one had let him go. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Faulty vehicle driver gets 8-day ban.description: NNTR officials have handed a eight-day ban for the driver whose gypsy broke down on June 11 evening in the core area following which the tourist had to walk for almost 4km to seek help. The ban is for driving a faulty vehicle and NNTR officials clarified that there is no connection to allegations of harassment made by the tourist. NNTR Deputy director (core) Poonam Pate said “We have finished the inquiry and found that the allegations were exaggerated. The timings of vehicle’s entry and exit were rechecked and there does not seem to be any major delay in helping the tourist.” About allegations about the tourist having to shell out extra cash, Pate said it was result of confusion. “The driver, who was supposed to pay the fine, did not have any cash on him and that’s why the tourist paid up. I reiterate, that this entire incident should not have happened and it’s unfortunate that it did,” said Pate. TOI had reported earlier this week about how 53 year-old tourist Ajay Agarwal was forced to walk in darkness inside the core area to reach a camp office for a rescue vehicle.
