Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

A year on, Pawankars still await justice.description: Nagpur: A year after the sensational Pawankar-Palatkar murder case shook up the city, the family of the deceased still awaits justice. While the Nandanvan police have submitted the chargesheet in the case, the family members are yet to come out of the shock.On June 11 last year, accused Vivek Palatkar allegedly went on a killing spree and murdered his brother-in-law Kamlakar Pawankar (53), Kamlakar’s wife Archana (45), their daughter Vedanti (15 and Kamlakar’s mother Meerabai (70). Palatkar also allegedly killed his four-year-old son with an iron rod.The only survivors of this incident were Palatkar’s elder daughter Vaishnavi and Kamlakar’s daughter Mitali, both aged eight years old at that time. All the eight people, including Palatkar, were asleep at Kamlakar’s house on June 10, 2018. Palatkar was later nabbed from Ludhiana on June 21.The incident had raised several questions over the city police. MLA Sudhakar Kohle too raked up the issue during the assembly session and demanded compensation for the surviving girls.Recently, under the banner of Akhil Bhartiya Sarva Vargiya Kalar Samjh (ABSVKS), the Pawankar family submitted a memorandum of demands to collector Ashwin Mudgal, including compensation for the two minor girls. The family members claimed that several politicians from the city, including chief minister Devendra Fadnavis, had promised compensation for the girls but they are yet to receive it.Kamlakar’s brother Keshav said “Several promises were made by many politicians that compensation will be given to the girls. But till now, no progress has been seen. In the last one year, no politician has come to visit the girls. They only made empty promises when it suited them but now they have forgotten us.”Keshav said that he is ready to do anything so that the accused gets strict punishment. While Kamlakar’s daughter is living with his sister, Palatkar’s daughter Maitili is living at a government home.President of ABSVKS Bhushan Dadwe said, “We have sent several letters regarding compensation to the girls and even met CM a couple of times. The CM had promised us that compensation will be given to the girls but nothing has happened.”Dadwe claimed that several politicians, including district guardian minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule, had written letter to the state government regarding compensation. “On one hand the government is promoting ‘Beti Padhao, Beti Bachao’ movement, but the future of these girls is in the dark due to lackadaisical attitude of the authorities,” he said.Resident deputy collector Ravindra Khajanji said, “We have sent the proposal of compensation to the CMO but are yet to receive any reply.”Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pvt doctors on strike today, only emerge.description: NAGPUR: All doctors across the state will go on strike for 24 hours from 6am on Monday to 6am on Tuesday. All non-essential services, including OPDs, will be withdrawn but emergency and casualty services will continue to function. The strike has been called by the Indian Medical Association (IMA) and all private doctors attached to IMA have agreed to participate in it. In Nagpur city, all private hospitals, clinics and diagnostic labs will remain closed. Doctors are observing this strike to protest the attack on medicos at NRS Medical College in Kolkata on June 11. “All members of IMA have decided to meet at the IMA Hall in the afternoon. We will discuss further course of action during this meeting,” said Dr Manjusha Giri of Nagpur IMA. “All hospitals will be closed for general check-ups and lab testing. Patients should avoid visiting hospitals and clinics for regular check-ups or tests,” she added. The hospitals will reopen on Tuesday morning. The strike is gaining support from doctors practicing other schools of medicines too. On Sunday, National Integrated Medical Association, the apex body of doctors practicing ayurveda and unani also expressed its support to the strike. “NIMA members across Maharashtra will join the strike called by IMA on June 17. We also request the society to lend its support to doctors’ demands for safety and justice,” reads a statement issued by NIMA. Doctors from other districts in Vidarbha will also be on strike on Monday. IMA Yavatmal district president Dr Anoop Kothari told TOI that doctors in Yavatmal will attend only emergency patients during the one-day strike. “All members of IMA and other medical professionals will assemble at local Saraswat Chowk at 8am and start a silent march to the district collector’s office where a delegation will meet collector Ajay Gulhane and submit a memorandum of demands,” said Dr Kothari. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Women-only e-buses to join Aapli Bus fle.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) transport department has placed an order to purchase five electric buses. The e-buses, which will be pink in colour, will ferry women passengers only. The buses will be added to NMC’s Aapli Bus fleet by July end, said transport committee chairman Bunty Kukde. The 32-seater midi bus will cost around Rs 1.29 crore each. The civic body had received Rs9.60 crore grant from the state government to ply women-only buses under Tejaswani Scheme. Kukde said earlier the civic body had decided to purchase diesel buses, but later decided to purchase electric buses as it will reduce the expenditure substantially and will cause no pollution. Currently, the NMC is plying 328 buses and has no women-only buses. It was a long-pending demand from women commuters to operate special buses for them. Sources said the NMC had received funds from the state government in early 2017. But the civic administration had exhausted the funds. Following directives from Kukde, the administration has made financial provision for electric buses. Kukde said the NMC has started the process to set up a charging station at NMC’s land on old Bhandara Road in Lakadganj area. The charging station can accommodate three buses at a time. Each bus needs three hours for charging and can run for almost 200km. According to Kukde, a bus will consume a unit to run a kilometre. This will curb NMC’s expenditure on city bus transportation significantly as the costing of one unit of power is around Rs12. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

High rates but low produce mean no gains.description: Nagpur: A season after they threw away onions on roads last December to protest slump in prices, farmers are hoping to turn a profit from the summer crop. Expecting that the current output may fall short of demand, farmers are holding on to their crop, which has led to a jump of nearly Rs300 a quintal in last 10 days. However, the bigger gain has been for those dealing in white onions, a rare variety but grown in large quantities in Amravati district. Prices of white onions have gone up by Rs500 a quintal in the last month. Low output of both red and white onions have spurred the prices. Traders say output of the red variety, which accounts for almost 70% of the country’s total produce, is down by 20% while that of white onion has been halved. The latter is largely used in processing industries which dehydrate onion for long-term use. The preserved onion also has major demand in the overseas market. The white onion mainly comes from Bhavnagar district in Gujarat. A fall in produce at Bhavnagar has led to Amravati’s gain. The processing units that mainly depend on Bhavnagar have increased purchases from Vidarbha, said traders in the region. A company has purchased as much as a lakh quintal from Amravati, said trade sources. Last year, the white onion did not fetch more than Rs400 a quintal. This year the rates opened at Rs900 to 1,000 and now have even touched Rs1,600 for the best quality, said Avinash Jastare of M/s LB Company at Amravati. “White onions would not be more than 30% of the total onion crop in the country. The white variety is also grown in Dhule and Nashik but in small quantities,” he said. Meanwhile, the red onions are being sold at Rs800 to 1,300 a quintal in bulk markets. This is an increase in the range of Rs100 to 300 a quintal. Farmers clear the fields of the onion crop during this part of the year, and prepare for the next harvest. “The dry spell coupled with excess heat this summer has damaged the crop of red variety too. Farmers are holding on to the produce at their warehouses, and that has led to a jump in prices. The demand from Gulf countries, Sri Lanka and Singapore too has gone up, and the area under cultivation has reduced,” said Manish Bora of M/s Paras Overseas at Nashik. However, a section of traders say despite the bullish trend the farmer may still not stand to gain much. Rather, the fall in output will level the gains made out of a higher price. A source at Afzal Trading Company at Kalamna said the production cost comes to Rs7 a kg for the red variety. So with an average rate of Rs8 to 9 per kg, the farmer may not gain much. For the white variety, the cost goes up to Rs10 a kg, he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Understanding, yet uncompromising.description: It is really a great privilege and a pleasant moment for Vidarbha to have two judges from the region on the Supreme Court benches who are eventually set to don the topmost judicial office of the Chief Justice of India. Let us celebrate this unique moment. I had a few opportunities to have a formal and informal interactions with one of them — recently appointed Bhushan Gavai — in personal, professional and institutional capacities from the days he was a practising advocate, then a government pleader and subsequently the judge of the Mumbai High Court (Sharad Bobde is the other judge from Vidarbha in SC). At a personal level, I had an association to gauge an important aspect of his personality deeply nurtured by the philosophy and teachings of the Buddha and rationally shaped by the thinking, thought processes and learning of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar. His socio-spiritual orientation indicated to me that he is also having a firm faith in the contributions made by the triad of social saints from Vidarbha — Sant Gajanan Maharaj, Sant Gadge Baba and Rashtrasant Tukdoji Maharaj manifesting Bhaktiyog, Karmayog and Dhyanyog, respectively, in their community-led actions to arouse the conscious of the masses. This common thread of personal trait had brought us in contact through a common acquaintance around 25 years ago. Gavai is a very spiritually-oriented and rationally thinking person with a pious heart as I could judge him from my association with him. My professional association with him goes to the time when he was the government pleader of the state in the high court and I was a state bureaucrat. I could foresee the in-depth judicial and analytical sharp bent of mind he possessed in the course of those interactions. It helped me throughout my career not only in my role as a bureaucrat but also for educating and advising my colleague and other government officers /advocates as how to strongly put forth/defend the state side in court matters. My institutional association with him was when he had been nominated to be the representative judge of the high court on the selection panel of judicial magistrates. I was the chairman of Maharashtra State Public Service Commission then and shared the panel with him. His vision as to the required capabilities and capacities of the occupants of the lower judiciary and strong sense to aptly assess requisite potential among the candidates was evident looking at the appropriate, pointed and probing questions he posed to them. I must not forget to mention a unique quality found in his personality. He would be absolutely blunt and severely punishing if anyone even made an iota of attempt to breach the protocol, however closely related or associated the one may be claiming to be with him. I may state with conviction that all the qualities envisaged to be rooted in high echelon of any judicial office are inherently ingrained in his person as also revealed by his first name itself as analysed here: B — Bold yet Balanced, H — Humane yet Hardcore; U — Understanding yet Uncompromising; S — Simple yet Savvy; H — Head with Heart; A — Articulate yet Absorbing; N — Neutral yet Natural. We wish him a very successful stint in the Supreme Court. (The writers is the former chairman of Maharashtra Public Service Commission) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

City\u2019s first Everester Pranav Bandb.description: NAGPUR: Pranav Bandbuche, a young mountaineer from Nagpur who recently conquered Mount Everest, was felicitated by mountaineer Nikhil Mundle at an event organized by Maitree Parivar and CAC Allrounder at Vishnuji Ki Rasoi. Pranav shared his thrilling experience of climbing the Everest, and how he made it his target to achieve this pinnacle of success in life. “I was always interested in adventure sports. The mountains, cool breeze and sports have drawn me to my passion. It was a chilling and absolutely breathtaking experience for me to complete the summit, and I felt like I was on top of the world, and I really was,” said Pranav. CAC All-Rounder organizes various adventure activities in the Himalayas during summer, like trekking, rock climbing, river crossing and rafting. Pranav also started his journey of adventure and excitement with this organization, which has helped people from China, Pakistan, India and Greece to take up their passion to climb. “My dream was to conquer the Everest and I knew I had to achieve it. My first attempt was in 2016, but I couldn't make it, but my passion didn’t die. So what if I failed once, I did it the second time, and I am proud of my achievement,” he added. Hundreds attempt to climb the mighty Everest every year, and only a handful make it to the final summit. The mountaineers complete a journey of four camps, other than the base camp, with temperatures of -50 degrees for 35 days. Camp number IV was the death zone for climbers, with the land inclined at 75 degree, which can cause accidents and deaths. “One of the moments I cherish from my incredible journey is that I got to see the sunset around 4.45am from the Everest, an experience I can never forget in my entire life. To add to it, I also got a rare glimpse of the shadow of Mt Everest on others mountains, forming a perfect triangle,” he said. Sarla Bandbuche, his mother, said, “I was not at all convinced when he told me about his dream, but his dream was bigger than my disapproval. I am proud of my son today for his extraordinary achievement.” Pranav was also felicitated by golfer Tejinder Singh Renu and chef Vishnu Manohar. Boy told to sit on hot tiles as punishme.description: WARDHA: An 8-year-old child was punished by forcing him to sit on a hot tile at noon in Arvi, causing burn injuries on his buttocks, on Saturday. The child was seriously injured and is undergoing treatment at Arvi general hospital. Police arrested the accused on Sunday. Accused Umesh alias Amol Dhore (32) and victim Aryan Khadse (8) are residents of Rani Laxmi Bai ward of Arvi. Aryan was playing in the Jogona Mata temple premises, as he usually does in the afternoon, on Saturday. Dhore suspected that Aryan had stolen some coins from the temple. To punish Aryan, Dhore tied his hands and forced him to sit on the hot tiles in the temple yard. Aryan suffered burn injuries on his buttocks. When Aryan’s father Gajanan Khadse came to know about the incident, he lodged a police complaint against Dhore’s action at Arvi police station on Saturday night. A case has been registered under Prevention of Atrocities Act at Arvi police station. The victim belongs to Matang community, which is considered as dalit. However, PSI and investigation officer Parmeshwar Agase said there is a doubt whether the accused punished the victim for simply entering the temple. “Usually, all children of this area play in the temple every day and nobody has any objections. We have arrested the accused and investigation is underway,” he said. Read this story in BengaliDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Gadchiroli SP gifts drinking water to re.description: NAGPUR: A remote tribal village in Maoist-affected Dhanora tehsil in north Gadchiroli got an unusual gift from superintendent of police (SP) Shailesh Balkawade. He brightened the lives of 400-450 villagers by bringing water to their doorstep at a time when the nearest ‘nullah’ outside the hamlet and a rickety hand pump both had gone dry in the harsh summer this year. Within a fortnight of Balkawade’s visit to Katejhari on May 29, two bore wells were dug at the village and a storage tank constructed. Around 20-22 taps, installed at intermittent distances, would now get water. Though his original mission was to visit the highly sensitive Katejhari village to meet family members of a Maoist and also the villagers, the district police chief won the hearts of the villagers with his water diplomacy. The village is known for its outright support for Maoists. But Balkawade proved that anti-Maoist operations need not always be with guns and grenades. The project, funded under the civic action programme of cops, turned out to be such a big occasion that the villagers wanted it to be inaugurated quickly. Instead of any officer or politician, it was one of the villagers, Bhimaji Kolhe, who inaugurated the water project on Friday. While Kolhe did the honours, the officers of Katejhari armed out post (AOP) sub-inspectors Akshaykumar Gorad, Sagar Warute and Jagannath Menkudle were cheering the event. Balkawade said he had gone to Katejhari to convince the family of a Maoist to surrender under the ‘Navjeevan' programme and also meet the villagers under ‘grambhet’ (village meet) to ask them about their grievances. “It was when I had just started to come back that some women and children approached me with two things. One, they had mentioned about drinking water problem and the other one was the deplorable condition of the Katejhari-Murumgaon road which is riddled with trenches and big pot holes,” he said. “The problem of drinking water was solved within a short period and now we are also pushing for the repair of the connecting road through our special funds. Providing drinking water was our priority as there was no provision available from where the villagers could draw water and given the heat their lives seemed to have become very tough in that dry terrain,” said the Balkawade. Over 1k delivery boys accuse Zomato of e.description: NAGPUR: Over 1,000 delivery boys attached to food delivery portal Zomato have struck work accusing the food aggregator of exploiting them by imposing ‘unrealistic’ incentive policy which has severely impacted their monthly income. They say so far they had been earning around Rs25,000-30,000 per month by working 16 hours a day. According to them, the company has increased the daily targets to 18 orders (Mon to Thursday) and 22 on weekends which is impossible to achieve and ultimately result in loss of incentives. “Without incentives, there is no earning for us,” says a delivery boy from Zomato’s Dharampeth zone. These boys have gone offline since last three days demanding rollback of the new policy and employment safeguards. On Sunday, they gathered at Traffic Park where they planned a massive rally to be taken out at Samvidhan Square on Monday. The company has denied any knowledge of the ongoing protest supported by Shiv Sena’s city unit. Zomato city manager Vipul Sinha said he wasn’t aware of the issue before disconnecting TOI’s call. Those who chose to work delivered food in plain clothes rather than the trademark red T-shirts to avoid confrontation with the protesters. Shiv Sena city coordinator Nitin Tiwari said the youths are ready to work even 16 hours a day but for earlier pay package. “They work for per order commission plus weekly incentives. Since Zomato’s entry in Nagpur, they have been delivery food from 7am to 11pm. Some even worked till 4am to meet the demanding targets. All they want is continuation of the same policy,” Tiwari said. Tiwari said the new policy makes completion of 18 orders per day from Monday to Thursday and 22 on weekends a must for incentive payouts between Rs575 to 700. Though the payout is marginally increased, it is impossible to cater the orders within 24 hours, Tiwari said. “No incentive is paid if you fall short of even one order,” he added. Another delivery agent said each order takes about one to one-and-half hours to complete before they are available for the next order. “We would need 28 hours to meet the new target. This is impossible. We have been somehow managing 16 orders by working over 16 hours in last one and half years. The distance between restaurant and client has increased now. None of bikers are given orders within 3 kms range after cycle riders were hired,” he said. “This is exploitation of jobless youths. The company is threatening to file police complaints against those who are raising voice against this injustice,” Tiwari said. One of the delivery boy said in case they don’t qualify for incentives, their earning would reduce to just 7,000 a month. Tiwari said he would be meeting the commissioner of police, labour commissioner and district collector on Monday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nHeart-wrenching tale enthralled Nagpur.description: A Marathi play Vyakti aani Valli was recently staged at Dr Vasantrao Deshpande Hall. Nagpur’s theatre buffs enjoyed a mélange of various characters and their eccentricities. Theatrical adaption of a book penned by legendary litterateur P L Deshpande, the rib-tickling play — directed by Chandrakant Kulkarni — had popular names from Marathi film and theatre world in the star cast. Actor-director Mahesh Manjrekar, Sunil Barve, Bhau Kadam, Anand Ingale etc. swept the audience off their feet with their impeccable comic timing and strong dialogue delivery. Needless to say, the auditorium reverberated with loud applause when the show ended. Gotya Sawant also garnered praises as a sutradhar. Former Union cabinet minister, Vilas Muttemwar with wife Chhaya, former Maha ministers Anil Deshmukh and Ranjit Deshmukh with wife Rupa enjoyed the play. Divisional Commissioner Anoop Kumar and IPS officers Deepali Masirkar and Rohan Samant were also spotted. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. \nAshwamedh staged at Ram Nagar Ground i.description: The tale and triumph of five rulers — Chandragupta Maurya, Harshvardhana, Prithviraj Chauhan, Krishnadevaraya and Swargnarayana — was beautifully narrated through Hindi mega play Ashwamedh, which was recently staged at Ram Nagar Ground. Nagpur’s theatre aficionados were enchanted with superlative performances of the artistes and the gripping story kept the audiences on the edge of their seats. What added grandeur to this two-hour show were colourful dance sequences and the magnificent set designs. Director of the play Dr Vinod Indurkar said, “The concept and technique of mahanatya is different than normal plays. You have a narrator, elaborate backdrops and recorded dialogues, which make for an entertaining theatrical treat for the viewers. It is overwhelming to see audience being so receptive and a good turnout is a great motivation for a creative person.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

18 mths on, Smart City Wi-Fi still not f.description: NAGPUR: Around 889 Wi-Fi access points were established across the city under the Rs520 crore Smart and Safe City Project over 18 months ago. Unfortunately, Wi-Fi services are yet to become fully operational. Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) special purpose vehicle for Smart City Project — Nagpur Smart and Sustainable City Development Corporation Limited (NSSCDCL) — through private operator L&T Construction’s Smart World and Communication Unit was supposed to provide Wi-Fi free of cost for 30 minutes, followed by charged access. For the last over 18 months, Wi-Fi for 30 minutes or up to 200 MB data is being provided free of cost at the 889 access points. But the main service of providing Wi-Fi after 30 minutes or at the end of 200 MB free data by taking charges has not been made operational. NMC sources told TOI Wi-Fi service could not be made completely operational just for want of payment gateway. “NSSCDCL and L&T were supposed to enter into an agreement with a bank for payment gateway. This simple process could not be completed in over 18 months,” sources said. Municipal commissioner Abhijit Bangar confirmed that Wi-Fi service was not available after 30 minutes or 200 MB. “I came to know about it recently. I have directed NSSCDCL officials to ensure payment gateway is operational as soon as possible. We will make it operational soon,” he said. Wi-Fi service under Smart and Safe City Project can be beneficial for individuals, institutions and commercial units across the city due to its high speed. An optical fibre cable of 600km has been laid under Smart and Safe City Project. Wi-Fi access points are connected with this network. Therefore, the speed of internet service is 10 MBPS. Also, Wi-Fi access points are established at major squares of the city in busy market places, commercial, administrative zones etc As reported by TOI on April 10, NMC head office and zone offices too were supposed to get free internet service at the speed of 10 MBPS under Smart and Safe City Project, but this has not been possible till date. The civic body is paying high charges to various operators to get internet in its offices. Bangar said this problem will also be solved soon. “I have directed NMC officials to coordinate with NSSCDCL officials and ensure internet services from Smart and Safe City Project,” he said. There are a few more components of Smart and Safe City Project which are yet to be made operational. One of these services is Smart Parking developed along Central Bazaar Road at Ramdaspeth. It is pending just for want of appointment of an agency for operation and maintenance. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray.
